=== [[Wikipedia talk:Non-free content#rfc_A21F6A6|Wikipedia talk:Non-free content]] expired 2023-01-03 17:01 ===
* Id: A21F6A6
* User: Alsee
* Date: 2022-12-04 16:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1125556047|POLICY 1125556047}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1131324755|POLICY 1131324755}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Proposing revision to non-Free image policy. Sometimes new software features will display relevant article images somewhere outside of the article, for example [[mw:Extension:Popups|ArticlePreview pop-ups]] and mobile [[mw:Extension:RelatedArticles|RelatedArticle links]]. Foundation staff are respecting [[WP:NFCP|non-Free content policy]], and each new feature can be configured to either include or exclude non-Free images as appropriate. Consensus [[WT:Non-free_content/Archive_65#Hovercards|approved non-Free images in ArticlePreviews]], as you are viewing a cropped version of the article itself with the image in educational context with related article text. On the other hand the RelatedArticle feature excludes non-free images. Policy calls out [[WP:Non-free_content#Multimedia|navigational use]] as unacceptable for non-Free images.

[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?go=Go&search=search+results%7E&title=Special%3ASearch&ns0=1 On-wiki search results] now include images, with non-free images currently excluded. Like Article Previews, search shows the image along with a cropped view of the article text. However search only shows about half as much text as Previews. For some portion of readers, the image + displayed article text in the search result may be a sufficient view of the article to fulfill their educational purpose for seeking that article, without needing to load the article page itself.

Propose to revise [[WP:Non-free content#Exemptions]]: "''Article images may appear <mark>within cropped article views in search results and</mark> article preview popups.''" [[User:Alsee|Alsee]] ([[User talk:Alsee|talk]]) 16:46, 4 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Politics#rfc_AA08280|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Politics]] expired 2023-01-03 20:01 ===
* Id: AA08280
* Date: 2022-12-04 19:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1125582976|POL 1125582976}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1131355563|POL 1131355563}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Wikipedia's lists of holders of political offices (presidents, governors, ministers, etc) are currently a hot mess, with people adding or removing whatever they like. Let us discuss the following:
#Should lists of officeholders contain separate lists (e.g. tables or galleries) of living former officeholders and point out who is the most recent to die? [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Deputy_Leader_of_the_Labour_Party_(UK)&oldid=1123093324#Living_former_deputy_leaders Example here].
#Should lists of officeholders contain separate tables for "superlatives" (youngest ever, third oldest ever, second shortest term, fourth longest term, etc)? [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_United_States_senators_from_Texas&oldid=1125242427#Superlatives Example here] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_presidents_of_Croatia&oldid=1124573660 here].
#Should lists of officeholders contain separate tables analyzing the officeholders' other political gigs? [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=List_of_governors_of_Florida&oldid=1125571331#Federal_offices_held Example here].
19:50, 4 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2022 COVID-19 protests in China#rfc_EE5F3C4|Talk:2022 COVID-19 protests in China]] expired 2023-01-07 00:01 ===
* Id: EE5F3C4
* User: Firestar464
* Date: 2022-12-23 10:04:00

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1132040034|POL 1132040034}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How should the status of the protests be described?

* '''Option 1''' Status quo- protests are to be described as ongoing.
* '''Option 2''' Protests should be described as having ended on December 5 (the last day protests were recorded in the Timeline section).
* '''Option 3''' Protests should be described as having ended on another date.
[[User:Firestar464|Firestar464]] ([[User talk:Firestar464|talk]]) 10:04, 23 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Scythians#rfc_51DFD85|Talk:Scythians]] expired 2023-01-07 19:01 ===
* Id: 51DFD85
* User: Antiquistik
* Date: 2023-01-06 23:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1132040029|HIST 1132040029}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1132200882|HIST 1132200882}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I've been editing the articles relating to the Scythians over the course of several months, and since most editors tend to favour splitting pages after they reach a certain size, I split two further pages, [[Iškuza]] and [[Scythia]], covering the phases of Scythian history respectively in West Asia and in Europe, out of the [[Scythians|main page covering the Scythians]].

However, trying to split it has resulted into three articles, with both [[Iškuza]] and [[Scythia]] requiring large amounts of material regarding the role of the prior and subsequent histories of the Scythians in the creation and destruction of those states copied from each other and from the [[Scythians]] page to exist since they are both about immediately preceding/succeeding states created by the same continuous population group. And because Iškuza and Scythia both cover immediately preceding/succeeding but also partially overlapping parts of the history of the Scythians, multiple sections and sub-sections of each page covering the culture, population, external relations, etc of these states also had to be copied from the Scythians page (e.g. the "Background" sub-section and "Society" section in Scythia, and the "Origins," "Impact," and "Legacy" sections of Iškuza). Moreover, the [[Scythia]] page as it exists now also functions as a [[WP:Semi-duplicate]], given that most of the information relating to this polity also is also the same basic information that is required on the [[Scythians]] page.

Given this resulting situation, I have started a [[Talk:Scythians#Merger proposal|merger proposal]] to resolve this issue, per [[WP:MERGEREASON]]: '''Overlap''', '''Context''', not because I support a merger for the sake of merging itself, which I do not favour, but because Iškuza and Scythia require too much context and the information on these pages is too intertwined with each other.

The problem is that, despite months having passed, the discussion for the merger proposal is still at a deadlock due to the bad faith of one user who has consistently opposed the merger on the basis of verifiably untrue accusations while other opponents to the merger have refused to engage in further discussion even when the issues they had have since been addressed or corrected. Due to this, we have three users opposed to the merger, and three users (including myself) in favour of it, while the other supporters of the merger have been telling me to resort to [[WP:BOLD]] and implement the merger.

In this situation, I am bringing this issue to [[Wikipedia talk:Dispute resolution noticeboard#Deadlock on proposal to merge Iškuza and Scythia into_Scythians|Wikipedia's dispute resolution noticeboard]] and to W:RFC with the hope of being able to resolve this deadlock. [[User:Antiquistik|Antiquistik]] ([[User talk:Antiquistik|talk]]) 23:30, 6 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Olivia Newton-John#rfc_88E31BF|Talk:Olivia Newton-John]] expired 2023-01-07 20:01 ===
* Id: 88E31BF
* User: Polyamorph#top
* Date: 2022-12-14 17:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1127435510|BIO 1127435510}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1133416299|BIO 1133416299}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the lead of [[Olivia Newton-John]], should we describe her as ''British born Australian'' or ''British-Australian''?

This follows from a previous RFC which 
[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk%3AOlivia_Newton-John&type=revision&diff=1107759264&oldid=1107728963 closed] with the statement "{{tq|'''There is a clear consensus to describe the article subject as some sort of British-Australian'''. There is a bit less of a consensus as to which specific terminology to use..."}}

The aim of this RFC is to find consensus for which terminology to use.

<small>'''''[[User:Polyamorph|Polyamorph]]''''' ([[User talk:Polyamorph#top|talk]])</small> 17:50, 14 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Al-Bayan (radio station)#rfc_03749A7|Talk:Al-Bayan (radio station)]] expired 2023-01-09 01:01 ===
* Id: 03749A7
* User: LaundryPizza03
* Date: 2022-12-10 00:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1126563394|SCI 1126563394}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1126563396|MEDIA 1126563396}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1132466557|MEDIA 1132466557}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should this article include a list of known radio frequencies associated with Al-Bayan in Iraq, Syria, and Libya? –[[User:LaundryPizza03|<b style="color:#77b">Laundry</b><b style="color:#fb0">Pizza</b><b style="color:#b00">03</b>]] ([[User talk:LaundryPizza03|<span style="color:#0d0">d</span>]][[Special:Contribs/LaundryPizza03|<span style="color:#0bf">c̄</span>]]) 00:39, 10 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (geographic names)#rfc_D50C7FD|Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (geographic names)]] expired 2023-01-09 08:01 ===
* Id: D50C7FD
* User: LlywelynII
* Date: 2022-12-10 07:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1126611936|HIST 1126611936}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1126611938|LANG 1126611938}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1126611941|POL 1126611941}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1126611943|STYLE 1126611943}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1126611944|POLICY 1126611944}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1132524643|HIST 1132524643}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1132524644|LANG 1132524644}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1132524648|POL 1132524648}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1132524649|STYLE 1132524649}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1132524652|POLICY 1132524652}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It seems bizarre that 20 years in we have no [[WP:MOS-Albania]] or [[MOS:Albania]], [[WP:Albania]] is just the wikiproject with no style guide, and there are 4 discussions of [[Albany, New York]], but none of [[Albania]] or its placenames in the archives here... but here we are. 

'''Every single Albanian placename has an indefinite''' (''any given'' Paris) '''and definite nominative form''' (''the specific'' Paris)'''. You might think ''all'' placenames are ''necessarily'' definite ''all the time'' but somehow they aren't''' and{{mdash}}this being the Balkans{{mdash}}somehow it's political. The subject has bizarrely never come up in the archive for [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Albania]]. [[Talk:Tirana#Tirana_or_Tiranë|This comment thread]] on [[Tirana]] (def. with Tiranë indef.) seems to be the only thorough discussion anywhere on the project... and it comes to no conclusions except to note that it seems like definite forms are more common for female Albanian names (=normal Latiny -a endings) versus indefinite forms being more common for male Albanian names (=leaving off the is and us and whatnot from the roots). There's also an accusation of racism and colonialism for preferring one of Albanian's own native grammatical structures... the correct one.

[https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/936425/Albania_factfile.pdf This UK guide] notes that ''Communist'' Albania preferred definite names (since... y'know... they refer to a single specific place) and therefore ''free'' Albania has generally preferred to use indefinite names... (since... uh...) except in certain cases where it was just too weird. The [https://books.google.com.hk/books?id=AXkRAAAAIAAJ&pg=PP12 old US gazetteers deferred to the Brits in the 1950s]; presumably they wouldn't now but aren't easily accessible via Google Books. The [https://www.cia.gov/the-world-factbook/countries/albania/map basic CIA info] seems to be random.

This leads to the exact same name for the exact same place being given in both forms: [[Himara]] for the Himara/Himarë District and [[Himarë (town)|Himarë]] for the Himara/Himarë Administrative Unit. No, agreement with the words for "district" and "unit" have nothing to do with the difference. It's ''exactly'' the same name, just presented inconsistently. Can we come to an agreement to always prefer the definite forms? Always prefer the indefinite forms except in truly egregious edge cases (Tirana isn't becoming Tiranë anytime soon)? or at least throw up a guide explaining what's going on here?&nbsp;—&nbsp;[[User talk:LlywelynII|<span style="text-shadow:#BBBBBB 0.1em 0.1em 0.1em; class=texhtml">Llywelyn<span style="color: Gold;">II</span></span>]] 07:12, 10 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran#rfc_EAEACDD|Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran]] expired 2023-01-09 14:01 ===

* Revisions affecting this RFC:

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1133521392|HIST 1133521392}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we replace the sentence ({{tq|It is also Iran's largest and most active political opposition group.{{sfn|Katzman|2001|p=97}}<ref>{{cite news |title=Ban on Iran opposition should be lifted, says EU court|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/lawreports/joshuarozenberg/3247818/Ban-on-Iran-opposition-should-be-lifted-says-EU-court.html |work=Telegraph |location= |quote=Iran’s main opposition group}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=People's Mujahidin Seeking Regime Change in Tehran|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/peoples-mujahidin-mek-dissidents-seeking-regime-change-in-tehran-rch5w8kn |work=The Times|location= |archive-url =https://web.archive.org/web/20220322125915/https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/peoples-mujahidin-mek-dissidents-seeking-regime-change-in-tehran-rch5w8knc |archive-date=March 22, 2022 |quote=the biggest and most resilient Iranian opposition group}}</ref>}}) with the following?
::{{tq|Some sources has described it as Iran's main,<ref>{{cite news |title=Ban on Iran opposition should be lifted, says EU court|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/lawreports/joshuarozenberg/3247818/Ban-on-Iran-opposition-should-be-lifted-says-EU-court.html |work=Telegraph |location= |quote=Iran’s main opposition group}}</ref> most active,{{sfn|Katzman|2001|p=97}} or biggest opposition group,<ref>{{cite news |title=People's Mujahidin Seeking Regime Change in Tehran|url=https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/peoples-mujahidin-mek-dissidents-seeking-regime-change-in-tehran-rch5w8kn |work=The Times|location= |archive-url =https://web.archive.org/web/20220322125915/https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/peoples-mujahidin-mek-dissidents-seeking-regime-change-in-tehran-rch5w8knc |archive-date=March 22, 2022 |quote=the biggest and most resilient Iranian opposition group}}</ref> Other sources described it as a "tiny revolutionary group stranded in Albania"<ref>{{Cite web |date=2018-11-09 |title=Terrorists, cultists – or champions of Iranian democracy? The wild wild story of the MEK |url=http://www.theguardian.com/news/2018/nov/09/mek-iran-revolution-regime-trump-rajavi |access-date=2022-11-16 |website=the Guardian |language=en|quote=after siding with Saddam – who indiscriminately bombed Iranian cities and routinely used chemical weapons in a war that cost a million lives – the MEK lost nearly all the support it had retained inside Iran. Members were now widely regarded as traitors.}}</ref> that has "little support inside Iran today"<ref>{{cite news |url= https://www.ft.com/content/c6ace172-33f2-11e8-a3ae-fd3fd4564aa6 |title= John Bolton support for Iranian opposition spooks Tehran |newspaper = [[Financial Times]] }}</ref> and "can now validly claim only to be highly organized and well (albeit illegally) funded"<ref>{{cite report |last1=Goulka |first1=Jeremiah |last2=Hansell |first2=Lydia |last3=Wilke |first3=Elizabeth |last4=Larson |first4=Judith |year=2009 | title=The Mujahedin-e Khalq in Iraq: A Policy Conundrum |publisher=[[RAND corporation]] |url=https://www.rand.org/content/dam/rand/pubs/monographs/2009/RAND_MG871.pdf|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160222043501/http://www.rand.org/content/dam/rand/pubs/monographs/2009/RAND_MG871.pdf |archive-date=22 February 2016 |url-status=live|quote=MeK repeatedly claims to be the most influential opposition group in that country, in reality it appears that this once-prominent dissident group can now validly claim only to be highly organized and well (albeit illegally) funded.}}</ref>}}
Yes or No? [[User:Ghazaalch|Ghazaalch]] ([[User talk:Ghazaalch|talk]]) 05:55, 15 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:New York City#rfc_4E8724D|Talk:New York City]] expired 2023-01-10 06:01 ===
* Id: 4E8724D
* User: CactiStaccingCrane
* Date: 2022-12-11 05:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1126782039|POL 1126782039}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1126782041|SOC 1126782041}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1132716953|POL 1132716953}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1132716956|SOC 1132716956}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which is better? Is it the current paragraph:

'''New York''', often called '''New York City''' or '''NYC''', is the [[List of United States cities by population|most populous city]] in the United States. With a 2020 population of 8,804,190 distributed over 300.46 square miles (778.2 km<sup>2</sup>), New York City is also the [[List of United States cities by population density|most densely populated]] major city in the United States, and is more than twice as populous as second-place [[Los Angeles]]. New York City lies at the southern tip of [[New York (state)|New York State]], and constitutes the geographical and demographic center of both the [[Northeast megalopolis]] and the [[New York metropolitan area]], the largest [[metropolitan area]] in the world by [[Urban area|urban landmass]]. With over 20.1 million people in its [[metropolitan statistical area]] and 23.5 million in its [[combined statistical area]] as of 2020, New York is one of the world's most populous [[Megacity|megacities]], and over 58 million people live within 250 mi (400 km) of the city. New York City is a [[Global city|global]] [[Culture of New York City|cultural]], financial, and [[Media in New York City|media]] center with a significant influence on commerce, [[Healthcare in New York City|health care]] and life sciences, [[The Entertainment Capital of the World|entertainment]], research, technology, [[Education in New York City|education]], [[Politics of New York City|politics]], [[Tourism in New York City|tourism]], [[Cuisine of New York City|dining]], art, [[Fashion capital|fashion]], and [[Sports in New York City|sports]].  Home to the [[headquarters of the United Nations]], New York is an important center for [[international diplomacy]], an established [[Safe haven currency|safe haven]] for global investors, and is sometimes [[Caput Mundi#New%20York%20City|described as]] the [[Caput Mundi|capital of the world]].

or is it the trimmed paragraph:

'''New York''', commonly known as '''New York City''' ('''NYC'''), is the [[List of United States cities by population|most populous city]] in the [[United States]] at southern tip of [[New York (state)|New York State]]. It is also the [[List of United States cities by population density|most densely populated]] major American city with a 2020 population of 8,804,190 distributed over 300.46 square miles (778.2 km<sup>2</sup>). It is a [[Global city|global]] [[Culture of New York City|cultural]], financial, and [[Media in New York City|media]] center with a significant influence on commerce, [[Healthcare in New York City|health care]] and life sciences, [[The Entertainment Capital of the World|entertainment]], research, technology, [[Education in New York City|education]], [[Politics of New York City|politics]], [[Tourism in New York City|tourism]], [[Cuisine of New York City|dining]], art, [[Fashion capital|fashion]], and [[Sports in New York City|sports]]. Home to the [[headquarters of the United Nations]], New York City is an important center for [[international diplomacy]], an established [[Safe haven currency|safe haven]] for global investors, and is sometimes described as the [[Caput Mundi|capital of the world]].

– [[User:CactiStaccingCrane|CactiStaccingCrane]] ([[User talk:CactiStaccingCrane|talk]]) 05:36, 11 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Maamme#rfc_39B1201|Talk:Maamme]] expired 2023-01-10 23:01 ===
* Id: 39B1201
* User: Lea 4545
* Date: 2022-12-11 22:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1126916273|MEDIA 1126916273}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1126916279|POL 1126916279}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1132857394|MEDIA 1132857394}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1132857404|POL 1132857404}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Should the description describe Maamme as "the de facto national anthem of Finland"?''' 

Accordingly, should the tag in the infobox be "National anthem of Finland"?

''This seems to be the consensus in edits and from the Talk page, however an individual user has repeatedly reverted "the de facto national anthem" to "an unofficial national anthem".'' [[User:Lea 4545|Lea 4545]] ([[User talk:Lea 4545|talk]]) 22:59, 11 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox country#rfc_8C2C14D|Template talk:Infobox country]] expired 2023-01-11 16:01 ===
* Id: 8C2C14D
* User: Rowing007
* Date: 2023-01-06 16:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1131957758|HIST 1131957758}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1132970543|HIST 1132970543}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For the {{code|Infobox country}} template on articles for historical versions of geographic entities (dead countries, colonies, etc.), we include the preceding and succeeding entities, but we do not do this for modern countries/territories. I propose that this be implemented for modern countries/territories, as this would facilitate the link for readers between a country/territory's past iterations and its current state. Yes, I know we have "History of ___" articles for practically all countries/territories, but I think adding the entity/entities which directly precede(s) modern countries/territories into their infoboxes would significantly improve the ease with which people can navigate articles to learn about history. For example, for [[Ghana]]: adding <code>p1 = Dominion of Ghana</code> and <code>flag_p1 = Flag of Ghana.svg</code>. Should this be implemented? [[User:Rowing007|Rowing007]] ([[User talk:Rowing007|talk]]) 16:00, 6 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Führer#rfc_28D1799|Talk:Führer]] expired 2023-01-13 22:01 ===
* Id: 28D1799
* User: 129.97.125.3
* Date: 2022-12-14 21:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1127467955|POL 1127467955}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1133454675|POL 1133454675}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the infobox for the political office "Führer and Reich Chancellor of the German People" as used in Nazi Germany be moved to the top (along with having the Nazism sidebar kept below it)? Should the images used in the page [[Führer]] be kept (specifically, the images for the standard of the Führer, the portrait of Hitler in the infobox, and the propaganda poster)? 

I suggest the following options to proceed:
* '''Option 1''': Keep images, move the infobox to the top.
* '''Option 2''': Keep images, leave infobox where it is.
* '''Option 3''': Do not keep images, move the infobox to the top.
* '''Option 4''': Do not keep images and leave the infobox where it is.

I request that any editors participating in this RfC include a reason for their announced support for whatever option they endorse, and further elaborate on how they wish to implement this if they wish. [[Special:Contributions/129.97.125.3|129.97.125.3]] ([[User talk:129.97.125.3|talk]]) 21:43, 14 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_CF813AA|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2023-01-14 07:01 ===
* Id: CF813AA
* User: Alsee
* Date: 2023-01-13 04:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1133349798|PROP 1133349798}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1133527768|PROP 1133527768}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The Wikimedia Foundation has [[WP:Village_pump_(miscellaneous)#Upcoming_vote_on_the_revised_Enforcement_Guidelines_for_the_Universal_Code_of_Conduct|announced]] that January 17 begins voting on a second attempt to obtain approval of Enforcement Guidelines for the Universal Code of Conduct. There has been no such voting on the content of the Universal Code of Conduct itself.

The primary intended outcomes of this RFC are:
* for the community to consider this prior to casting a vote on the Enforcement Guidelines; 
* informing the Foundation of any portion of the community who will not approve Enforcement Guidelines unless a Code of Conduct is approved first;
* the Foundation perhaps reconsidering whether to obtain community approval for Code of Conduct itself.

Is the Universal Code of Conduct enforceable even if the Code itself has not been formally approved by the community? [[User:Alsee|Alsee]] ([[User talk:Alsee|talk]]) 04:46, 13 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists#rfc_73CD164|Talk:Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists]] expired 2023-01-15 13:01 ===
* Id: 73CD164
* User: Jabbi
* Date: 2022-12-16 12:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1127752498|HIST 1127752498}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1127752501|POL 1127752501}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1133774193|HIST 1133774193}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1133774196|POL 1133774196}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article confusingly (see [[Talk:Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists#Current_status|above discussion]]) references more than one historical entity with the same or similar name.

* The original organization was founded in 1929
* In 1940 the OUN split into two factions:
** OUN-B led by Stepan Bandera, often associated with emigres
** OUN-M led by Andriy Melnyk
* From this point on it is unclear what organisation, if any, is referred to as OUN.

To preclude any misunderstanding, this page should become a disambiguation page that explains the above and links to relevant articles: [[Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists (B)]], [[Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists (M)]], etc.

I want to state that I am starting this section, not because I think the above is necessarily the best solution, but I think an involved discussion of several editors would be helpful to move this along.

[[User:Jabbi|Jabbi]] ([[User talk:Jabbi|talk]]) 12:36, 16 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran#rfc_74B6426|Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran]] expired 2023-01-19 09:01 ===
* Id: 74B6426
* User: Ghazaalch

* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1131668445|HIST 1131668445}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We currently have the following two sentences for MEK's ideology in the lede:
*{{tq| Its revolutionary interpretation of Islam contrasts with the conservative Islam of the traditional clergy as well as the [[populist]] version developed by [[Ayatollah Khomeini]] in the 1970s.{{Update inline|date=December 2022}}{{sfn|Abrahamian|1989|p=1}}}}
*{{tq|critics have described the group as "resembling a cult",<ref>{{cite book |last1=Erlich |first1=Reese |title=The Iran Agenda Today: The Real Story Inside Iran and What's Wrong with U.S. Policy |date=2018 |publisher=Routledge |isbn=978-0-429-94157-3 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=PUNvDwAAQBAJ&q=Iran+Agenda:+The+Real+Story+of+U.S.+Policy+and+the+Middle+East|access-date=14 January 2020|quote="But critics question that commitment given the cult of personality built around MEK's leader, Maryam Rjavi."|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.middleeasteye.net/big-story/Iranian-MEK-US-terror-list-halls-congress-PMOI-Iran|title=How Iranian MEK went from US terror list to halls of Congress|website=Middle East Eye}}</ref><ref>[https://www.cbc.ca/radio/thecurrent/the-current-for-july-4-2018-1.4732996/stephen-harper-criticized-for-speaking-at-free-iran-event-hosted-by-dissident-group-1.4733009 CBC]</ref> while its backers describe the group as proponents of "a free and democratic Iran" that could become the next government there.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/jul/15/trump-allies-visit-throws-light-on-secretive-iranian-opposition-group-mek|title=Trump allies' visit throws light on secretive Iranian opposition group|date=15 July 2019|website=The Guardian}}</ref>}}

Should we replace them with the following:
{{talk quote|In its violent revolutionary struggle which is reflected in its name, Mojahedin-e Khalq  (the People's Holy Warriors),{{sfn|Goulka|Hansell|Wilke|Larson|2009|p=2}}<ref>{{cite book|author=Gavin R. G. Hambly|title=The Cambridge History of Iran, Volume 7|publisher=[[Cambridge University Press]]|page=284}}</ref><ref>{{cite encyclopedia|title=Conflict in the Modern Middle East: An Encyclopedia of Civil War, Revolutions, and Regime Change|entry=Mujahedin-e Khalq (MEK)|page=208|publisher=[[ABC-CLIO]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|author=[[Mahan Abedin]]|title=Iran Resurgent: The Rise and Rise of the Shia State|publisher=[[C. Hurst & Co.]]|page=60|year=2019}}</ref> Mojahedin embraced a combination of Marxism and Islamism as the base of their belief.<ref>{{cite book |first=Ervand |last=Abrahamian |author-link=Ervand Abrahamian |title = Iran Between Two Revolutions |publisher = Princeton University |year=1982 |url=https://doi.org/10.2307/j.ctv1fkgcnz |doi=10.2307/j.ctv1fkgcnz|quote=This ideology can be described best as a combination of Islam and Marxism. As Ruhani and Haqshenas stated years later, 'our original aim was to synthesize the religious values of Islam with the scientific thought of Marxism|page=92}}</ref><ref> {{cite book |first=Kenneth |last=Katzman |chapter=Iran: The People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran |title = Iran: Outlaw, Outcast, Or Normal Country? |publisher = [[Nova]] |year=2001 |editor-first = Albert V. |editor-last = Benliot |isbn = 978-1-56072-954-9|p=99|quote=Scholars generally describe the PMOI ideology as an attempt to combine Islam with revolutionary Marxism}}</ref>{{sfn|Goulka|Hansell|Wilke|Larson|2009|p=2}} Later on, in 1985, [[Massoud Rajavi|Rajavi]]'s "ideological revolution" imbued the MEK with many typical characteristics of a cult.{{sfn|Goulka|Hansell|Wilke|Larson|2009|p=38}}<ref>{{Cite web |date=2018-11-09 |title=Terrorists, cultists – or champions of Iranian democracy? The wild wild story of the MEK |url=http://www.theguardian.com/news/2018/nov/09/mek-iran-revolution-regime-trump-rajavi |access-date=2022-11-16 |website=the Guardian |language=en|quote=Rajavi launched an “ideological revolution”, banning marriage and enforcing mandatory “eternal” divorce on all members, who were required to separate from their husbands or wives. He married one of the new divorcees, Maryam Azodanlu, who became, in effect, his chief lieutenant and took his name.}}</ref>}}
Yes or NO? [[User:Ghazaalch|Ghazaalch]] ([[User talk:Ghazaalch|talk]]) 05:50, 5 January 2023 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Monty Hall problem#rfc_434AB6C|Talk:Monty Hall problem]] expired 2023-01-19 18:01 ===
* Id: 434AB6C
* User: GabeTucker
* Date: 2023-01-19 11:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1134587510|SCI 1134587510}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1134632870|POLICY 1134632870}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Are the changes proposed in the above proof reasonable for the direct calculation section of the [[Monty Hall problem]] page?

Someone undid my changes because I accidentally typed "Monty Python problem" instead of Monty Hall problem. This was confirmed on [[user_talk:EEng|EEng's talk page]]. But when I reimplemented my changes correcting this typo, someone undid these changes thinking it was an edit war. I have done everything possible in order to show that this is just confusion rooted in a misunderstanding from that initial typo, as no one has actually issued any grievances with my proof (except [[user:MrOllie]], who simply said it was less preferable without responding to any of my points), but this has been to no avail. I just need someone to look at my proof and say whether it's good or bad so that I can finally reimplement my changes (assuming it's good). Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thank you.

[[User:GabeTucker|GabeTucker]] ([[User talk:GabeTucker|talk]]) 11:39, 19 January 2023 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
There has lately been a lively discussion of the appropriateness of including the phrase "convicted felon" in the opening sentence of a biography. A consensus-building discussion has taken place at [[Wikipedia_talk:Biographies_of_living_persons/Archive_46#Applying_controversial_labels_to_people|Here]] and [[Wikipedia talk:Biographies of living persons#%22Convicted Felon%22 in the lead]]. There are also various arguments presented in favor of removing the phrase here on the talk page, but no arguments presented against it so far.

Therefore, my question is this: should the phrase "convicted felon" be excluded from the opening sentence of David Duke's page? [[User:Philomathes2357|Philomathes2357]] ([[User talk:Philomathes2357|talk]]) 01:44, 21 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Tabiti#rfc_FF2B82B|Talk:Tabiti]] expired 2023-01-20 12:01 ===
* Id: FF2B82B
* User: Antiquistik
* Date: 2023-01-19 14:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1134609694|HIST 1134609694}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1134750183|HIST 1134750183}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I have been overhauling the page for the [[Scythian religion]] for a while, and I have added new information drawn from reliable and significant academic sources to its section on the Scythian goddess Tabiti. Much of this information on Tabiti would however be better presented on a separate page for this deity, and it appears that the information added fits the criteria of [[WP:Notability]] for creating a new page for Tabiti.

However, the page for Tabiti was deleted due to sockpuppetry and the addition of fringe views and only administrators can now edit it. Therefore, I am requesting for the permission to create a new page for Tabiti, seeing as the new information fits the criteria for [[WP:Notability]]. I am also placing a request for comment regarding the creation of this new page. [[User:Antiquistik|Antiquistik]] ([[User talk:Antiquistik|talk]]) 14:02, 19 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:String Quartets, Op. 20 (Haydn)#rfc_549BFA6|Talk:String Quartets, Op. 20 (Haydn)]] expired 2023-01-24 07:01 ===
* Id: 549BFA6
* User: Ravpapa
* Date: 2022-12-25 06:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1129416521|MEDIA 1129416521}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1135369561|MEDIA 1135369561}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is a disagreement over the importance of Opus 20 to the development of the string quartet form. The lead presented the opus as "a milestone in the history of composition". An editor has revised that lead to suggest that Haydn's contribution to string quartet development is exaggerated, and that a number of other, far less known, composers were equally responsible for advancement of the form.

A more detailed description of the disagreement appears in the previous section. [[User:Ravpapa|Ravpapa]] ([[User talk:Ravpapa|talk]]) 06:13, 25 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Intelligent design#rfc_BF5232C|Talk:Intelligent design]] expired 2023-01-24 18:01 ===
* Id: BF5232C
* User: Jenhawk777
* Date: 2023-01-23 05:18:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1135196333|RELI 1135196333}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1135440199|RELI 1135440199}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I suggest this article needs to be retitled for better precision, less ambiguity and less confusion for our readers. Everyone agrees this article covers one aspect of a larger subject, specifically it's on the effort to push creationism into the public schools in Kentucky. Leaving this article titled as it is, with the [[Common name]] of the broad topic, implies it is a main article when this is actually a sub topic. That creates ambiguity and confusion. Per [[WP:Precision]], this article needs retitling to represent its actual scope. [[Intelligent design creationism]] or [[Intelligent design in Kansas]] or [[Kansas schools fight Intelligent design]] or [[Intelligent design and pseudoscience]] - anything that isn't simply "Intelligent design" by itself. For that we need a main article. [[User:Jenhawk777|Jenhawk777]] ([[User talk:Jenhawk777|talk]]) 05:18, 23 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Italian political parties#rfc_FBD60D0|Template talk:Italian political parties]] expired 2023-01-25 14:01 ===
* Id: FBD60D0
* User: Scia Della Cometa
* Date: 2022-12-26 13:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1129652057|POL 1129652057}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1129652064|SOC 1129652064}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1142769843|POL 1142769843}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1142769848|SOC 1142769848}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What kind of structure should be applied to the [[Template:Italian political parties]]?
*'''A''': a structure based on the principle of representation, like [[Template:Spanish political parties]] (example: parties represented in the Chamber, in the Senate, in the European Parliament, in the Regional Councils);
*'''B''': a structure based on the principle of territoriality, similar to the current version of the [[Template:Italian political parties]] (example: countrywide parties, regional parties, overseas parties);
*'''C''': a mixed structure, including both the principle of representation and territoriality (with a drop-down structure, like [[User:P1221/sandbox|this  sandbox]] and similar to the [[Template:Malaysian political parties]]).
Please express your order of preference for the three proposals in the survey, with a brief explanation. [[User:Scia Della Cometa|Scia Della Cometa]] ([[User talk:Scia Della Cometa|talk]]) 13:41, 26 December 2022 (UTC)}}

Should people be included in the categories of the form '[Nationality] expatriates in [country]' (e.g. [[:Category:American expatriates in England]]) for a single period of study, or a posting to that country?  (Absent any reliable sources calling them an 'expatriate'.)

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Politics of the United Kingdom#rfc_CD91A6C|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Politics of the United Kingdom]] expired 2023-01-26 11:01 ===
* Id: CD91A6C
* User: Colonestarrice
* Date: 2022-12-27 10:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1129847174|POL 1129847174}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1135713063|POL 1135713063}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are significant discrepancies between the "appointer" parameter of infoboxes on articles related to executive, judicial, and military offices in the United Kingdom. (e.g. [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Chancellor_of_the_Exchequer&oldid=1128757910 2], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Home_Secretary&oldid=1127452172 3], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Secretary_of_State_for_Justice_(UK)&oldid=1123244878 4], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Secretary_of_State_for_Defence&oldid=1129271097 5], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Lord_President_of_the_Council&oldid=1127240052 6], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Advocate_General_for_Northern_Ireland&oldid=1122933874 7]) To establish consistency between these articles, should the parameter say: appointed by...

*A) The [[Monarchy of the United Kingdom|Monarch]]
*B) [[The Crown]]
*C) the [[Monarchy of the United Kingdom|Sovereign]]
*D) the [[Monarchy of the United Kingdom|King]] 

...on advice of the [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom|Prime Minister]].

– [[User:Colonestarrice|Colonestarrice]] ([[User talk:Colonestarrice|talk]]) 10:27, 27 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:WikiProject Weather/Color RfC#rfc_DFACD47|Wikipedia:WikiProject Weather/Color RfC]] expired 2023-01-27 16:01 ===
* Id: DFACD47
* User: Hurricane Noah
* Date: 2022-12-31 23:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1130787650|SCI 1130787650}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1130787654|STYLE 1130787654}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1130787659|POLICY 1130787659}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1135904441|SCI 1135904441}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1135904446|STYLE 1135904446}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1135904449|POLICY 1135904449}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which '''THREE''' color scheme proposals above best satisfy [[MOS:ACCESS]], are aesthetically pleasing, and should proceed to the final selection process? There are 9 proposals above and only 3 will be chosen here to proceed to the final selection process. The table within each of the proposals should give a good idea of how accessible the colors are for various types of color blindness. A map for normal vision is shown to give an idea of how the scale would look against the map background. Please note that Potential Tropical Cyclone and Severe Tropical Storm colors are infobox/template only and do not appear on maps. Additionally, links are not allowed on colored backgrounds per prior RfC so any colors only need to contend with black text. [[User:Hurricane Noah|<span style="white-space:nowrap;text-shadow:#009200 0.3em 0.4em 1.0em,#009200 -0.2em -0.2em 1.0em;color:#009200"><b>Noah</b></span>]]<sup>[[User talk:Hurricane Noah|<span style="color:#ff0000"><b>Talk</b></span>]]</sup> 23:16, 31 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Africa#rfc_4524CA4|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Africa]] expired 2023-01-30 06:01 ===
* Id: 4524CA4
* User: LaundryPizza03
* Date: 2022-12-31 05:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1130642064|HIST 1130642064}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1130642066|LANG 1130642066}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1130642069|POLICY 1130642069}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1136418646|HIST 1136418646}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1136418650|LANG 1136418650}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1136418652|POLICY 1136418652}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Based on usage in independent, reliable sources, how should this country be named in Wikipedia articles? {{Ordered list |list_style_type=upper-alpha
| {{xt|Gambia}} (no definite article)
| {{xt|the Gambia}} (lowercase ''the'')
| {{xt|The Gambia}} (capital ''The'')
| Either A or B
| Either A or C
| Either B or C
| No preference }}
Current usage on Wikipedia varies by article, and sometimes even within the same article: for example, [[Gambia–Senegal border]] and [[Gambia–Spain relations]] use only A, [[The Gambia|the main article]] and most page titles use B exclusively, and [[Politics of the Gambia]] and [[The Gambia at the 2016 Summer Olympics]] use only C; [[Yahya Jammeh]] inconsistently mixes B and C. Two RfC's at [[Talk:The Gambia]] failed to reach consensus. –[[User:LaundryPizza03|<b style="color:#77b">Laundry</b><b style="color:#fb0">Pizza</b><b style="color:#b00">03</b>]] ([[User talk:LaundryPizza03|<span style="color:#0d0">d</span>]][[Special:Contribs/LaundryPizza03|<span style="color:#0bf">c̄</span>]]) 05:35, 31 December 2022 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Suicide Silence (album)#rfc_1F1CCA8|Talk:Suicide Silence (album)]] expired 2023-01-31 12:01 ===
* Id: 1F1CCA8
* User: Tobi999tomas
* Date: 2023-01-01 11:56:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1130875277|MEDIA 1130875277}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1136647756|MEDIA 1136647756}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the introductory sentence be "American deathcore band" or "American metal band"? Changing the lead genre to match the band's article no matter what genre is the album. The band itself is described as deathcore, not heavy metal. If we have to change it to heavy metal, we must do it on all pages, not just one page in particular. The biggest example, Bring Me the Horizon. Their only deathcore album is ''Count Your Blessings'' and just because of one album we have to change the introductory sentence to "British deathcore band" while the rest is "British rock band"? I don't think so. Even the most notable page, such as Metallica is consistent. Sure, the first four albums are thrash metal, but in the end they also play two different genres of metal. So in the end, instead of "American thrash metal band", they are written in all pages as "American heavy metal band". So they are two options to resolve this, either write Suicide Silence as "American deathcore band" or as "American heavy metal band". None of them are wrong. So can we agree that "American heavy metal band" will be in the introductory sentence in all the pages related to the band? Since they played more than just deathcore, then I guess heavy metal would be better for the lead. Lead genres should be broad. If not, "American deathcore band" should be in the introductory sentence. --[[User:Tobi999tomas|Tobi999tomas]] ([[User talk:Tobi999tomas|talk]]) 11:56, 1 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Coat of arms of Lithuania#rfc_EC44E47|Talk:Coat of arms of Lithuania]] expired 2023-02-01 00:01 ===
* Id: EC44E47
* User: Marcelus
* Date: 2023-01-04 18:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1131566370|HIST 1131566370}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1136758060|HIST 1136758060}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is an article on the coat of arms of Lithuania, Belarus historically used a similar one (Pahonia, rejected by the Lukashenko regime in 1995), both symbols have the same history of being the coat of arms of the Grand Duchy of Lithuania. The section on Belarus should address this, and briefly describe the history of Pahonia's use in Belarus. 

At present, however, in my opinion, the section on Belarus is far from that. It unnecessarily repeats information about Belarus that can be found in the relevant articles, overelaborate compared to the rest of the article are the contents about the cooperation of some Belarusian activists with Lithuania in 1919 and the Belarusian military unit formed at its side in Grodno (the disarmament of this detachment by the Polish army is described in strange detail), as well as the 1995 referendum in which Belarusians rejected the Pahonia as the country's emblem. It is not difficult to fend off the impression that the article is written in a rather biased way and tries to convince us of something. First to the fact that Belarusians never had any statehood before 1918, that they owe their traditions to Lithuania, and that they never really wanted the Pahonia as an emblem, which they expressed in the 1995 referendum (a quick read of the [[1995 Belarusian referendum]] article shows that it was a bit more complicated than that).

In [[User:Marcelus/sandbox5|my sandbox]] I wrote an alternative proposal for this chapter. I tried to make it comprehensive, but also short.

As [[User:Cukrakalnis|Cukrakalnis]] rejects the changes I made and does not agree with my opinion, I request the comment from the community. I also ping [[User:GizzyCatBella|GizzyCatBella]] who participated in the discussion. [[User:Marcelus|Marcelus]] ([[User talk:Marcelus|talk]]) 18:53, 4 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view/Noticeboard#rfc_0391F3E|Wikipedia:Neutral point of view/Noticeboard]] expired 2023-02-01 22:01 ===
* Id: 0391F3E
* User: Shorn again]] 
* Date: 2023-01-27 19:09:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1136915332|POL 1136915332}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1136915334|POLICY 1136915334}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1136924352|POL 1136924352}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1136924360|POLICY 1136924360}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The use of "''Widely described as''" in the second sentence is [[MOS:WEASEL|weasel words]]. Some other editors seem to disagree adamantly. Attempted to make changes citing sources to either replace weasel words or provide more factual context for the reader. My edits, intended to maintain [[Wikipedia:NPOV|NPOV]], were quickly reverted by other editors for what appears to be nitpicky reasons and potentially some ''[[argumentum ad populum]]'' concerning the disputed [[Wikipedia:NPOV|NPOV]]/[[MOS:WEASEL|WW]]. 

I'm concerned that their preconceptions about the social network (for example "Gab = bad" or "Alt tech = bad") is clouding their editorial judgment. It appears that most of the article — most alarmingly right in the first paragraph / lead section — presents heavy negative bias and criticism. In fact, I would say in the current state of the article, the controversy surrounding Gab is more emphasized than what Gab actually even is. I am concerned with "''how facts are selected, presented, or organized''" (Quote from: [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view|NPOV (Neutral point of view)]] ).


Please help resolve this issue. 

See: [[Talk:Gab (social network)]] - Where I explained my reasoning in depth. 

See: [[Gab (social network)]] - The article in question. 


<big>'''Relevant Diffs:'''</big>

https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Gab_(social_network)&diff=prev&oldid=1134253361

https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Gab_(social_network)&diff=prev&oldid=1135801747


<big>'''User Page Notice(s):'''</big> 

I have posted "NPOVN-notice" notices on the related user talk pages, particularly to the editors who seem to have an issue with my edits. (i.e.: [[User talk:Shorn again]] | [[User talk:HandThatFeeds]] | [[User talk:Writ Keeper]] | [[User:Slatersteven]])

I have also received an edit war accusation in the form of a notice from [[User:Slatersteven]] because of my attempts to correct the lack of [[Wikipedia:NPOV|NPOV]] in this article. The notice is currently visible on my user page: [[User talk:Commandur]]. [[User:Commandur|Commandur]] ([[User talk:Commandur|talk]]) 19:09, 27 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Gab (social network)#rfc_97DC81C|Talk:Gab (social network)]] expired 2023-02-01 23:01 ===
* Id: 97DC81C
* User: Commandur
* Date: 2023-01-21 04:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1136915332|POL 1136915332}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1136915334|POLICY 1136915334}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1136933499|POL 1136933499}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1136933502|POLICY 1136933502}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article about Gab is not written in an impartial tone. "Widely described as a haven" is not neutral phrasing. Widely described by whom? When you claim it is widely known that way, you need to say by whom, otherwise this is described as "[[Weasel_word|weasel words]]" according to [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view]]. 

Wikipedia has policies about neutrality, nonjudgmental language, weasel words, impartial tone, etc. The rules of Wikipedia to remain neutral are ''just as important as the rule to use reliable sources while writing or editing Wikipedia articles. Not '''less''' important.'' Saying something is "widely described" on an controversial article, without saying who it is widely described by in-line, is not a neutral way of writing. 

I also want to address that the first paragraph of the article is heavily biased against Gab due to the way in which the facts are presented and organized, starting with heavy negative criticism from the cited sources filling the majority of the first paragraph. Most articles list critics and their criticism further down in the article under a subheading such as "Criticism and controversies", which seems to be the method of consensus across most of Wikipedia. It is fine to have some criticism and negative statements in the lede paragraph, but it should not be the primary focus. 

Please check the [[Wikipedia:Neutral point of view|NPOV (Neutral point of view) article]] that states "inappropriate tones can be introduced through how facts are selected, presented, or organized".

While this is self-evident to unbiased editors, I have also found sources that indicate that Gab being described as a "haven" is a statement from critics and not necessarily a widely-accepted fact: 

•  "Critics claim the site serves as a haven for extremist groups." - https://www.liferaftinc.com/blog/resources/gab-explained

•  "has been billed by some as the social network for the alt-right" - https://www.inc.com/salvador-rodriguez/gab-apple-twitter.html

Notice the terms used: "critics claim" and "has been billed by some as". This means there is not a near-complete consensus on the matter. 

Although I have only just heard about Gab for the first time within the last week and have never used it myself, I am amazed at how many unnecessary arguments have occurred on this talk page. NPOV is a policy of Wikipedia and it is counterproductive to argue against NPOV as it benefits all good-faith users and editors of Wikipedia. 

The irony of censoring NPOV edits on an article about a website that has been banned from most big tech platforms for allowing it's users mostly unrestricted freedom of speech is not lost on me. This type of behavior is why people create alternative websites in the first place. 

I humbly ask that another unbiased editor or administrator should reinstate my revision or make a similar revision to bring the article up to NPOV standards.  
 - [[User:Commandur|Commandur]] ([[User talk:Commandur|talk]]) 04:49, 21 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:United States House of Representatives#rfc_5142A4F|Talk:United States House of Representatives]] expired 2023-02-03 04:01 ===
* Id: 5142A4F
* User: Bbraxtonlee
* Date: 2023-01-04 03:33:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1131432004|POL 1131432004}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1137164641|POL 1137164641}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Did the new members of the US House during the 118th congress actually take office on January 3, 2023?'''
There are many people on Wikipedia who say that the 20th Amendment guarantees that members take office on noon January 3, 2023. However, many prominent legal scholars and news sources (sourced below) say otherwise. The point of this RfC is to put the correct date as agreed to by members of the Wiki community.
[[User:Bbraxtonlee|Bbraxtonlee]] ([[User talk:Bbraxtonlee|talk]]) 03:33, 4 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran#rfc_9768D86|Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran]] expired 2023-02-04 06:01 ===
* Id: 9768D86
* User: Ali Ahwazi
* Date: 2023-01-14 20:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1133643338|HIST 1133643338}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1139185226|HIST 1139185226}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The first sentence in the lead reads:
* {{tq|…is an Iranian political-[[militant]] organization.<ref>{{cite book |last1=Crane |first1=Keith |last2=Lal |first2=Rollie |title=Iran's Political, Demographic, and Economic Vulnerabilities |year=2008 |publisher=Rand Corporation |isbn = 9780833045270 |url = https://books.google.com/books?id=PmlMdb5ACHEC&q=militant+organization&pg=PA26 |access-date=11 September 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last=Pike |first=John |title = Mujahedin-e Khalq Organization (MEK or MKO) |url = https://www.globalsecurity.org/military/world/para/mek.htm |website=www.globalsecurity.org |access-date=5 October 2018 |quote=...the largest and most militant group opposed to the Islamic Republic of Iran. |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20181222084149/https://www.globalsecurity.org/military/world/para/mek.htm |archive-date=22 December 2018 |url-status=dead }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title = Mujahadeen-e-Khalq (MEK) |url = https://www.cfr.org/backgrounder/mujahadeen-e-khalq-mek |website = [[Council on Foreign Relations]] |access-date=5 October 2018 |quote = ...the largest militant Iranian opposition group committed to the overthrow of the Islamic Republic,}}</ref>}}
This sentence has not been updated yet. Should it be replaced with:
{{talk quote|... is an <s>unpopular<ref>{{cite news |last1=Torbati |first1=Yeganeh |title=Former U.S. officials urge Trump to talk with Iranian MEK group |url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-trump-iran-opposition-idUSKBN1502FF |agency=Reuters |date=2017 |quote=The MEK’s supporters present the group as a viable alternative to Iran’s theocracy, though analysts say it is unpopular among Iranians for its past alignment with Iraqi leader Saddam Hussein and attacks on Iranian soldiers and civilians.}}</ref>{{sfn|Goulka|Hansell|Wilke|Larson|2009|p=77}}</s> Iranian militant opposition group headquartered in [[Albania]].<ref>{{cite book |last1=Crane |first1=Keith |last2=Lal |first2=Rollie |title=Iran's Political, Demographic, and Economic Vulnerabilities |year=2008 |publisher=Rand Corporation |isbn = 9780833045270 |url = https://books.google.com/books?id=PmlMdb5ACHEC&q=militant+organization&pg=PA26 |access-date=11 September 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title = Mujahadeen-e-Khalq (MEK) |url = https://www.cfr.org/backgrounder/mujahadeen-e-khalq-mek |website = [[Council on Foreign Relations]] |access-date=5 October 2018 |quote = ...the largest militant Iranian opposition group committed to the overthrow of the Islamic Republic,}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2018-11-09 |title=Terrorists, cultists – or champions of Iranian democracy? The wild wild story of the MEK |url=http://www.theguardian.com/news/2018/nov/09/mek-iran-revolution-regime-trump-rajavi |access-date=2022-11-16 |website=the Guardian |language=en}}</ref>}}
[[User:Ali Ahwazi|Ali Ahwazi]] ([[User talk:Ali Ahwazi|talk]]) 20:14, 14 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Mikalojus Konstantinas ?iurlionis#rfc_3E3222B|Talk:Mikalojus Konstantinas ?iurlionis]] expired 2023-02-08 19:01 ===
* Id: 3E3222B
* User: Cukrakalnis
* Date: 2023-01-09 18:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1132621144|HIST 1132621144}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1132621145|MEDIA 1132621145}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1138251913|MEDIA 1138251913}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In [[Mikalojus Konstantinas Čiurlionis]], there is a dispute about using the [[Template:Efn]] for foreign-language names (Russian and Polish). I justify this move by pointing to articles where that is already the case: [[Joseph Stalin]] (Russian and Georgian names are in Efn), [[Napoleon Bonaparte]] (French, Italian and Corsican names are in Efn), etc. Two users, @[[User:GizzyCatBella|GizzyCatBella]] and @[[User:Marcelus|Marcelus]], are against this and insist on removing the Efn. One of the users, Marcelus, accuses me of trying to "hide" Čiurlionis' Polish name ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk%3AMikalojus_Konstantinas_%C4%8Ciurlionis&diff=1132598968&oldid=1132591404]), while simultaneously removing the Russian name ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mikalojus_Konstantinas_%C4%8Ciurlionis&diff=1132435371&oldid=1132434471], [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Mikalojus_Konstantinas_%C4%8Ciurlionis&diff=1132440507&oldid=1132437142]). Should the foreign-language names be put in an Efn or not? [[User:Cukrakalnis|Cukrakalnis]] ([[User talk:Cukrakalnis|talk]]) 18:39, 9 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather#rfc_DD789AC|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Weather]] expired 2023-02-09 14:01 ===
* Id: DD789AC
* User: Elijahandskip
* Date: 2023-01-27 22:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1135953904|SCI 1135953904}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1138403049|SCI 1138403049}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The [[Talk:List of F5 and EF5 tornadoes/Discussion|recent discussions]] (and [[Talk:List of F5 and EF5 tornadoes]]), with the intent to improve the [[List of F5 and EF5 tornadoes#Possible F5/EF5/T10+ tornadoes officially rated F4/EF4/T9 or lower|Possible F5/EF5/T10+ tornadoes officially rated F4/EF4/T9 or lower]] & [[List of F5 and EF5 tornadoes#Possible F5/EF5/T10+ tornadoes with no official rating|Possible F5/EF5/T10+ tornadoes with no official rating]] sections, has potentially shown a bunch of errors that are potentially unfixable with the lists. Multiple editors have expressed concerns with the list over the years (and especially with the recent discussions). It it time for the WikiProject to have a discussion about fully scrapping the list. This would allow for a potential new discussion to arise in the future for the list to comeback at a time when 100% clear guidelines can be put in place. Important to note that this list has been discussed on the talk page since 2007 (evident in [[Talk:List of F5 and EF5 tornadoes/Archive 1]]), meaning debates and discussions will never go away and have been ongoing for over a decade. [[User:Elijahandskip|Elijahandskip]] ([[User talk:Elijahandskip|talk]]) 22:08, 27 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Reliable sources#rfc_6C6DE6B|Wikipedia talk:Reliable sources]] expired 2023-02-10 00:01 ===
* Id: 6C6DE6B
* User: DecafPotato
* Date: 2023-02-09 20:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1138465083|POLICY 1138465083}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1138491029|POLICY 1138491029}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As AI is becoming increasingly prevalent and beginning to be used by sources considered reliable, I think it is time to ask: ''are sources written by an AI reliable, regardless of publication''? If an AI article is written by a reliable publication, does it differ from an article written by the same AI from a situational or unreliable publication? Does that differ from an average person using that same AI? What about articles only ''assisted'' by an AI? (see also: [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#Beware: CNet running AI-generated articles, byline "CNet Money"|the ongoing RSN discussion of ''CNET'']]). [[User:DecafPotato|DecafPotato]] ([[User talk:DecafPotato|talk]]) 20:38, 9 February 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_5E989D7|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2023-02-13 08:01 ===
* Id: 5E989D7
* Date: 2023-01-19 19:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1134648655|PROP 1134648655}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1140167925|PROP 1140167925}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Ok, so for me, there's a lot not to like about the new layout.

But someone else can start that eventual RfC : )

I just want to focus on one very specific thing: the talk link being moved to a drop down.

Hiding the talk link is a very very bad idea.

We operate on the consensus model here.

Hiding the talk link just reinforces that edit-warring is the way to go.

And no, I really don't care what some off-site discussion was - so I don't need to hear an WMF employee breezily tell me that a talk page link was determined to not be important on Wikipedia. I'm happy to engage in discussion, but don't blow us off by referring elsewhere as if this project does not matter please. (As an aside, and this goes far beyond this simple RfC - But just thought I'd mention that while I respect the WMF in general - I think it's very important - but I'm really not happy about how things seem to be being pushed through, with fewer and fewer discussions being allowed to be "open" for anyone to participate.)

Anyway, if we weigh importance, I think it's easy to agree that the talk link is more important than the watchlist link. So if space ''really'' is the issue argued, then swap them. Or maybe combine "alerts" and "notices" to save space. Or whatever other ideas people may have.

Whatever the case, '''un-hide the talk link'''. - <b>[[User:Jc37|jc37]]</b> 19:30, 19 January 2023 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_D5C3B13|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2023-02-13 08:01 ===
* Id: D5C3B13
* User: Alsee
* Date: 2023-01-14 07:53:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1133534240|PROP 1133534240}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1139083264|PROP 1139083264}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The Wikimedia Foundation has [[WP:Village_pump_(miscellaneous)#Upcoming_vote_on_the_revised_Enforcement_Guidelines_for_the_Universal_Code_of_Conduct|announced]] that January 17 begins voting on a second attempt to obtain approval of Enforcement Guidelines for the Universal Code of Conduct. There has been no such voting on the content of the Universal Code of Conduct itself.

Does the community Endorse or Oppose approval of Enforcement Guidelines prior to, or in the absence of, any community approval of a Code of Conduct itself?

This RFC is intended to determine and communicate a consensus position. Editors may consider this during current or future Enforcement Guideline votes, and the Wikimedia Foundation may consider it when evaluating how to proceed if the second Guideline vote turns out worse than the first vote. [[User:Alsee|Alsee]] ([[User talk:Alsee|talk]]) 07:53, 14 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Applied behavior analysis#rfc_57E12FB|Talk:Applied behavior analysis]] expired 2023-02-13 09:01 ===
* Id: 57E12FB
* User: Oolong
* Date: 2023-01-14 08:24:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1133541279|SCI 1133541279}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1133541283|POL 1133541283}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1139090174|SCI 1139090174}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1139090176|POL 1139090176}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
ABA is a controversial practice. Going by polls, and statements made by a large number of representative organisations, it appears to be highly unpopular with its main target population, autistic people; on the other hand, it is backed up by research (also controversial) and forms a multi-billion-dollar industry supported by various governments. It is sometimes described as the 'gold standard in autism treatment'.

How best to reflect these controversies, in the lead section and elsewhere? References elsewhere on this Talk page.

[[User:Oolong|Oolong]] ([[User talk:Oolong|talk]]) 08:24, 14 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Lok Sabha#rfc_8BD0765|Talk:Lok Sabha]] expired 2023-02-14 13:01 ===
* Id: 8BD0765
* User: SharadSHRD7
* Date: 2023-01-15 12:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1133774196|POL 1133774196}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1139308021|POL 1139308021}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is no alliance-based [[Parliamentary group]]s in the [[Lok Sabha]] and [[Rajya Sabha]]. Alliances are formed by political parties for general election, but they are not parliamentary groups (Legislatures in some countries like [[France]] follows the alliance-grouping system, but there is no such system followed in [[Lok Sabha]] and [[Rajya Sabha]]). In my opinion, adding alliances is unnecessary, because they're not official parliamentary groups and tends to be [[WP:SPECULATIVE]]. Also, this is one of the reasons for frequent edit war (adding and removing parties under an alliance). Here I'm seeking [[WP:CONSENSUS]] on whether adding alliances in the [[Lok Sabha]] and [[Rajya Sabha]] should be allowed or not. Thank you. [[User:SharadSHRD7|SharadSHRD7]] ([[User talk:SharadSHRD7|talk]]) 12:07, 15 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran#rfc_70E061E|Talk:People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran]] expired 2023-02-15 14:01 ===
* Id: 70E061E
* User: Ali Ahwazi
* Date: 2023-01-31 15:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1136679413|HIST 1136679413}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1142473415|HIST 1142473415}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The lede currently contains the following:
* {{tq|After the fall of Pahlavi, the MEK boycotted the [[December 1979 Iranian constitutional referendum]] and Khomeini prevented [[Massoud Rajavi]] and other MEK members from running for office.<ref>{{cite report |last1=Goulka |first1=Jeremiah |last2=Hansell |first2=Lydia |last3=Wilke |first3=Elizabeth |last4=Larson |first4=Judith |year=2009 | title=The Mujahedin-e Khalq in Iraq: A Policy Conundrum |publisher=[[RAND corporation]] |url=https://www.rand.org/content/dam/rand/pubs/monographs/2009/RAND_MG871.pdf|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160222043501/http://www.rand.org/content/dam/rand/pubs/monographs/2009/RAND_MG871.pdf |archive-date=22 February 2016 |quote=However, after the fall of the Shah, Khomeini suppressed opposition and prevented Rajavi and many MeK members from running for office in the new government.}}</ref>{{sfn|Abrahamian|1989|pp=197-198}}{{sfn|Katzman|2001|p=101}}}}
Should it be replaced with the following? 
*{{tq|After the fall of Pahlavi, the MEK boycotted the [[December 1979 Iranian constitutional referendum]], which led to Khomeini barring MEK leader [[Massoud Rajavi]] from the [[1980 Iranian presidential election]].{{efn| Khomeini declared that "those who had failed to endorse the Constitution could not be trusted to abide by that Constitution."{{sfn|Abrahamian|1989|p=198}}}}<ref>{{cite book |first=Ervand |last=Abrahamian |author-link=Ervand Abrahamian |title = Radical Islam: The Iranian Mojahedin |year=1989 |publisher = I.B. Tauris |isbn = 978-1-85043-077-3|quote=The Mojahedin also refused to participate in the referendum held in December to ratify the Constitution drafted by the Assembly of Experts … Once the Constitution had been ratified, the Mojahedin tried to field Rajavi as their presidential candidate ... Khomeini promptly responded by barring Rajavi from the election by declaring that those who had failed to endorse the Constitution could not be trusted to abide by that Constitution.}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |first=Kenneth |last=Katzman |chapter=Iran: The People's Mojahedin Organization of Iran |title = Iran: Outlaw, Outcast, Or Normal Country? |publisher = [[Nova]] |year=2001 |editor-first = Albert V. |editor-last = Benliot |isbn = 978-1-56072-954-9|quote=Khomeini refused to allow Masud Rajavi to run in January 1980 presidential elections because the PMOI had boycotted a referendum on the Islamic republican constitution.|page=101}}</ref>}}
Yes or No? [[User:Ali Ahwazi|Ali Ahwazi]] ([[User talk:Ali Ahwazi|talk]]) 15:05, 31 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Ronald Reagan#rfc_070EDCD|Talk:Ronald Reagan]] expired 2023-02-16 21:01 ===
* Id: 070EDCD
* User: 7milestoHope
* Date: 2023-02-14 14:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1139324952|BIO 1139324952}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In several ways, especially it’s very dark color scheme, the current infobox photo (1981) is arguably one of the worst official presidential photographs we use here on the Wiki. I have proposed his 1985 presidential photograph as a replacement. This photo is more visually appealing, allows the reader to see more of the president's face, and is more encompassing to his presidency as whole since it was taken at the start of his second term. 

I am interested in hearing other's thoughts. [[User:7milestoHope|7milestoHope]] ([[User talk:7milestoHope|talk]]) 14:02, 14 February 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Mykola Kostomarov#rfc_79D90B7|Talk:Mykola Kostomarov]] expired 2023-02-17 07:01 ===
* Id: 79D90B7
* Date: 2023-01-18 06:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1134279446|BIO 1134279446}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1134279450|HIST 1134279450}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1134279454|POL 1134279454}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1134279455|SOC 1134279455}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1139859023|BIO 1139859023}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1139859028|HIST 1139859028}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1139859029|POL 1139859029}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1139859034|SOC 1139859034}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the lead describe Mykola Kostomarov as “a leading symbol of the [[Ukrainian national revival]]<ref>[[Paul Robert Magocsi]] 1996, ''A History of Ukraine'', University of Toronto Press, p&nbsp;361. “. . . three figures who were to become the leading symbols of the Ukrainian national revival: Mykola Kostomarov, Panteleimon Kulish, and Taras Shevchenko. ¶ Mykola Kostomarov was born in far eastern Sloboda Ukraine near Voronezh . . .”</ref> and one of the founders of modern Ukrainian historiography and literature<ref>[[Serhii Plokhy]] 2015, ''The Gates of Europe: A History of Ukraine'', New York: Basic Books p&nbsp;156. “A professor of history at Kyiv University, Mykola (Nikolai) Kostomarov—he would later become the founder of modern Ukrainian historiography . . . Born to the family of a Russian noble in Voronezh province on the border of Sloboda Ukraine, Mykola Kostomarov often stressed that his mother was a Ukrainian peasant woman.”</ref><ref>[[Andrew Wilson (historian)]] 2002, ''The Ukrainians: Unexpected Nation'' (2nd ed.), Yale University Press, p&nbsp;88. “Even one of the great founding fathers of Ukrainian history and literature, Mykola Kostomarov, . . .”</ref>” in the first paragraph, before listing his individual accomplishments?&nbsp;—''[[user:Mzajac|Michael]]&nbsp;[[user_talk:Mzajac|Z]].'' 06:23, 18 January 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Next Indian general election#rfc_9F5F3D8|Talk:Next Indian general election]] expired 2023-02-18 14:01 ===
* Id: 9F5F3D8
* User: SharadSHRD7
* Date: 2023-01-19 13:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1132771562|POL 1132771562}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1140111546|POL 1140111546}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
India has a multi-party system having 8 [[List of political parties in India|parties]] with national status. Adding only two prominent national parties (BJP and INC) in the Infobox seems unfair and against [[WP:NPOV]]. <s>According to [[2019 Indian general election|2019 election results]], AITC is the third largest national party with 22 seats and 4.06% votes (Although DMK got 24 seats and 2.34% votes, it's a state party and part of UPA led by INC). I support adding third largest national party in the Infobox irrespective of their vote and seat share.</s> I support using [[Template:Infobox legislative election]] until the announcement of election results. After results, we can switch into image based [[Template:Infobox election]]. This will ensure the fair representation without bias and prevent edit wars in future. [[User:SharadSHRD7|SharadSHRD7]] ([[User talk:SharadSHRD7|talk]]) 13:10, 19 January 2023 (UTC)}}
