=== [[Talk:Glyphosate#rfc_CE7C32F|Talk:Glyphosate]] expired 2023-08-27 22:01 ===
* Id: CE7C32F
* User: Gtoffoletto
* Date: 2023-08-26 23:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1172421096|SCI 1172421096}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1172563560|SCI 1172563560}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
On 6 July 2023 the EFSA published a [https://www.efsa.europa.eu/en/factsheets/efsa-explains-scientific-assessment-glyphosate factsheet] and a [https://www.efsa.europa.eu/en/news/glyphosate-no-critical-areas-concern-data-gaps-identified press release] following the conclusion of its peer review of the risk assessment of glyphosate. On its [https://www.efsa.europa.eu/en/topics/topic/glyphosate official Glyphosate page] it states: {{tq|6 July 2023 EFSA shares its conclusions on the peer review of glyphosate with the European Commission and Member States to inform the decision they will take about whether to keep glyphosate on the EU list of approved pesticide active substances. EFSA publishes a factsheet and a press release, summarising the conclusions. The full conclusions are expected to be published by the end of July 2023 and the background documents relating to the risk assessment and peer review are expected to be published between the end of August and the middle of October 2023}}. The fact sheet provides a "condensed" version of the conclusions (the full conclusions were [https://www.efsa.europa.eu/en/efsajournal/pub/8164 published] on 26 July 2023 and are 52 pages long) and highlights the "main conclusions" in the full report.

Is the factsheet an accurate and reliable summary of the EFSA's conclusions?   <span style="color:#AAA"><small><nowiki>&#123;{u&#124;</nowiki></small>[[User:Gtoffoletto|<span style="color:darkGreen;font-weight:bold">Gtoffoletto</span>]]<small><nowiki>&#125;}</nowiki></small></span>  <sup>[[User talk:Gtoffoletto|'''talk''']]</sup> 23:12, 26 August 2023 (UTC)}}

* User: Sitush

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We have a multitude of lists of members of castes, such as [[List of Rajputs]] and [[List of Brahmins]]. We also have existing consensus relating to castes in [[WP:CASTEID]] and the consensus that we do not categorise people by caste. There is a tension between the lists and the current caste-related consensus, not to mention long-standing concerns regarding [[WP:BLP]] and [[WP:V]]. Deprecating caste lists, and deleting the extant ones, would resolve the tension. - [[User:Sitush|Sitush]] ([[User talk:Sitush|talk]]) 19:30, 30 July 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Domestic violence#rfc_E19EFC7|Talk:Domestic violence]] expired 2023-08-29 22:01 ===
* Id: E19EFC7
* User: Panamitsu
* Date: 2023-08-28 11:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1172569895|POL 1172569895}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1172569898|SOC 1172569898}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1172878261|POL 1172878261}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1172878264|SOC 1172878264}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Other sources suggest that the victims are gender neutral. But this article does not include any information on the scientific debate on gender symmetry. Should the article both views on the debate? Remove the "overwhelming"?

This idea is known as gender symmetry. There is a lot of debate among scholars about whether the genders are both victimised similarly. To me it seems to be a violation of [[WP:NPOV]] for the article to completely omit the fact that it is under debate. See [[Domestic violence against men#Gender symmetry]] and [[Intimate partner violence#Gender symmetry]].

One of the sources is a [[literature review]] of 1,700 studies on domestic violence, and it suggested that the genders are equal. Completely ignoring this perspective is a massive [[WP:NPOV]] violation.

Apologies for having seperate threads, I wasn't aware about how RfC is supposed to be formatted.

[[User:Panamitsu|Panamitsu]] ([[User talk:Panamitsu|talk]]) 11:16, 28 August 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:What Wikipedia is not#rfc_34414FE|Wikipedia talk:What Wikipedia is not]] expired 2023-09-04 20:02 ===
* Id: 34414FE
* Date: 2023-09-01 17:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1173321569|POLICY 1173321569}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1173849398|POLICY 1173849398}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This policy is almost as old as the project, but it no longer reflects editing practice. It also causes vast amounts of drama at AfD. Consider the areas where some Wikipedians have zealously advocated for categorical inclusion, or "inherent notability":
* Census designated places
* Highways
* Railway stations
* Schools
* Olympic athletes
We have had fights over whether categories can be included or deleted (e.g. SMALLCAT) where the limit on size is largely imposed by this policy. We have had people who have been banned multiple times with sometimes dozens of sockpuppets because they refuse to accept this policy (e.g. Sander.v.Ginkel). Few things are more guaranteed to cause an inclusionist / deletionist fight than an essentially unsourceable article about something that nevertheless is needed to make a directory complete. Of course this is partly because lists don't self-maintain, and summary text minor entries can't be included in categories without an article - and individuals have preferences for lists v. categories for sound reasons in both cases.

At the very least we need to acknowledge that Wikipedia ''is'' a directory of some things. We can argue until we're blue in the face about dropping sourcing standards to allow inclusion, but the entire drama seems unnecessary if we simply bow to the inevitable here. '''[[user:JzG|Guy]]''' <small>([[user talk:JzG|help!]] - [[User:JzG/Typos|typo?]])</small> 17:58, 1 September 2023 (UTC)}}

There exists a disagreement (see [[Talk:The Good, the Bad and the Ugly#Mexican standoff|Talk § Mexican standoff]]) as to whether the film's climax is a [[Mexican standoff]] or a [[truel]], with the film being mentioned in both articles pop culture sections. === [[Talk:Cauchy sequence#rfc_868E536|Talk:Cauchy sequence]] expired 2023-09-05 13:01 ===
* Id: 868E536
* User: Tensorproduct
* Date: 2023-09-01 23:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1173365167|SCI 1173365167}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1173964607|SCI 1173964607}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A ''Cauchy sequence'' is also called a ''fundamental sequence''. There are many math books (by big mathematicians such as [[Israel Gelfand]]) that use the word fundamental sequence instead of Cauchy sequence. I used as a source a book by another mathematician [[Heinz-Dieter Ebbinghaus]]. If I remember correctly, it was the original name before people started to call it a Cauchy sequence. The user [[User:JayBeeEll]] keeps on reverting my edit without giving me a proper explanation. The user only says it makes the article worse but does not explain why or even discuss the issue properly. I think this is an important piece of information for an encyclopedia and it should be in the article. And in no way makes it the article worse.--[[User:Tensorproduct|Tensorproduct]] ([[User talk:Tensorproduct|talk]]) 23:26, 1 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Millennials#rfc_DC9986C|Talk:Millennials]] expired 2023-09-06 01:02 ===
* Id: DC9986C
* User: Richie wright1980
* Date: 2023-08-07 00:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1169102087|SOC 1169102087}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1174049708|SOC 1174049708}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose to improve the opening paragraph of the article to:

"'''''Millennials, also known as Generation Y or Gen Y, are the demographic cohort following Generation X and preceding Generation Z. There are no precise or set definitions although researchers and popular media use the early 1980s as starting birth years and the mid-1990s to early 2000s as ending birth years. It has been argued that millennials are typically defined as the generation born between 1981 to 1996, although 1980 has also been used as the earliest starting birth year.'''''"

A couple of people here have suggested that 1981 is the 'widely' accepted starting birth year and the lede should not contain any reference to 1980 at all. They cite two sources to support this case (<ref name="Rauch">{{cite news|url=https://worldin2019.economist.com/millennialsvboomers|title=Generation next, Millennials will outnumber baby-boomers in 2019|last1=Rauch|first1=Jonathan|date=November 2018|newspaper=The Economist|access-date=13 March 2019|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190315052954/https://worldin2019.economist.com/millennialsvboomers|archive-date=15 March 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Millennials cheer New Zealand lawmaker's "OK, Boomer" remark|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/us-newzealand-millennials/millennials-cheer-new-zealand-lawmakers-ok-boomer-remark-idUSKBN1XG2YT|date=6 November 2019|publisher=Reuters}}</ref>). Only one of these sources supports this assertion while the other is out of date and not in support of this assertion in any case. There are countless examples of 1980 now being used as the starting year and it does not stand up to scrutiny that 1980 should be excluded from the lede. In any case, the article actually explicitly references 1980 as an alternative starting birth year within the "Date and age range definitions" section.

I propose to improve and clarify the lede based on the latest information and information already covered within the article. Therefore, making it more encyclopedic.[[User:Richie wright1980|Richie wright1980]] ([[User talk:Richie wright1980|talk]]) 00:07, 7 August 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Barbenheimer#rfc_70045E8|Talk:Barbenheimer]] expired 2023-09-06 03:03 ===
* Id: 70045E8
* User: JSH-alive
* Date: 2023-09-05 11:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1173957876|HIST 1173957876}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1173957879|MEDIA 1173957879}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1173957884|POL 1173957884}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1174063121|HIST 1174063121}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1174063124|MEDIA 1174063124}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1174063126|POL 1174063126}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It seems the [[Japanese Wikipedia]]'s [[:ja:バーベンハイマー#日本の反応|バーベンハイマー#日本の反応]] has more texts than what this article's "[[Barbenheimer#Japanese response|Japanese response]]" section currently does, so why not incorporate more content from there? But before we go, there are some things to consider. On one hand, as the only country to be attacked by nuclear weapons, the use of [[mushroom cloud]] image as a humour or in a lighthearted context is considered to be inappropriate in Japan. On the other hand (and correct me if I'm wrong), most of Japanese people are not sufficiently educated about any wrong doings of the [[Empire of Japan]] and [[Imperial Japanese Armed Forces|its armed forces]] during their existence, and especially the [[World War II|Second World War]], which led to the droppings of the bombs by the United States in the first place.<sup>1</sup> Additionally, at the time the social media controversy arose, the contemporary [[Government of Japan|Japanese government]] was considering whether or not (or rather, when) to [[Discharge of radioactive water of the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant#Discharge to ocean, treated water|dump the radioactive wastewater from the 2011 Fukushima nuclear disaster into the Pacific Ocean]]. Hope these add much to the context.

By the way, I'd like to recommend everyone to read ''[[Barefoot Gen]]'', which criticises both the war crimes of Imperial Japan, and America's dropping of atomic bombs.

:<sup>1</sup> But let's not cite some non-notable sources {{diff|Barbenheimer|prev|1169139757|like last time}}. Perhaps we can wait until a notable anti-Japanese expert writes an opinion for a major outlet, and then a pro-Japanese expert replies with a counter-claim (like in November 2019 when an [https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2019/nov/01/japan-rising-sun-flag-history-olympic-ban-south-korea anti-Japanese historian called for a ban] of [[Rising Sun Flag]] in the venues of [[2020 Summer Olympics]] in Tokyo, Japan, for being a symbol of Japanese imperialism, and a press secretary from the [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Japan)|Japanese Ministry of Foreign Affairs]] [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/nov/12/japans-rising-sun-flag-is-not-a-symbol-of-militarism called that opinion to be based on a misunderstanding]).

[[User:JSH-alive|JSH-alive]]/<sup>[[User talk:JSH-alive|talk]]/[[Special:Contributions/JSH-alive|cont]]/[[Special:Emailuser/JSH-alive|mail]]</sup> 11:22, 5 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of Marvel Cinematic Universe television series#rfc_7F098EA|Talk:List of Marvel Cinematic Universe television series]] expired 2023-09-10 03:02 ===
* Id: 7F098EA
* User: ChimaFan12
* Date: 2023-09-04 22:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Football#rfc_6D5261B|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Football]] expired 2023-09-13 11:01 ===
* Id: 6D5261B
* User: Stevie fae Scotland
* Date: 2023-08-14 10:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1170323130|SOC 1170323130}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1170323133|STYLE 1170323133}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1175195957|SOC 1175195957}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1175195958|STYLE 1175195958}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How should national football team articles be titled?

It has been mentioned a few times now that a wider discussion is needed regarding the naming convention for national football teams with regards to the inclusion of gender (see [[Talk:Sweden men's national football team#Requested move 27 July 2023|here]], [[Talk:Scotland national football team#Requested move 12 April 2023|here]] and [[Talk:Australia men's national soccer team/Archive 7#Requested move 24 December 2021|here]] for more info) and I feel this is more appropriate than a massive RM involving 200+ articles. It also allows more easily for flexibility if there are differing consensus across countries. I've tried to keep the question as neutral as I can but I would like to hear opinions on how consistent the use of gender in article titles should be and what editors should consider before moving a page. [[User:Stevie fae Scotland|Stevie fae Scotland]] ([[User talk:Stevie fae Scotland|talk]]) 10:23, 14 August 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of California hurricanes#rfc_2564340|Talk:List of California hurricanes]] expired 2023-09-14 22:01 ===
* Id: 2564340
* User: CurryTime7-24
* Date: 2023-09-13 18:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1175251503|HIST 1175251503}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1175251505|SCI 1175251505}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1175417805|HIST 1175417805}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1175417810|SCI 1175417810}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk:List_of_California_hurricanes&diff=prev&oldid=1175225496 recent IP comment] made a valid point about the nomenclature used for this list's title. I initiated this RfC in order to determine whether consensus exists to rename this list.

Options:

* 1: '''List of California hurricanes, tropical storms, and depressions'''
**'''Pro''':
***Current name is misleading because records only confirm that one hurricane has ever passed through California.
***All others listed systems were tropical storms, depressions, or remnants thereof.
**'''Con''':
***Complicated name.
***Study of the [https://www.aoml.noaa.gov/hrd/Landsea/chenowethlandsea.pdf AMS paper that reported] the discovery of the [[1858 San Diego hurricane|one hurricane to make landfall in California]] suggests that its conclusion may have been reached by educated guessing rather than firm evidence.

* 2: '''List of California hurricane remnants'''
**'''Pro''':
***Concisely sums up the various tropical storms, depressions, etc. listed.
***Makes clear that listed weather phenomena were not hurricanes upon making landfall in California.
**'''Con''':
***Unfamiliar name.
***Some listed systems were remnants of tropical storms and depressions.
***Needs an explanatory note in the lead or elsewhere in the list explaining that the [[American Meteorological Society|AMS]] reported on the recorded existence of one hurricane in 1858. 

* 3: '''Maintain current name'''
**'''Pro''':
***Familiarity.
***Most of these listed weather phenomena had originated as hurricanes prior to making landfall in California, which for a wider audience may qualify as a "California hurricane".
**'''Con''':
***Misleading name.
***Only one listed storm qualifies as being a hurricane.

—[[User:CurryTime7-24|CurryTime7-24]] ([[User talk:CurryTime7-24|talk]]) 18:16, 13 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Polyvagal theory#rfc_534BEC4|Talk:Polyvagal theory]] expired 2023-09-16 00:01 ===
* Id: 534BEC4
* User: Ian Oelsner
* Date: 2023-08-16 23:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1170748663|SCI 1170748663}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1175572962|SCI 1175572962}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Is it appropriate for the academic theory, “Polyvagal Theory” to be characterized as “unproven” in the lead? Here’s the sentence:
 '''Polyvagal theory''' (''poly-'' "many" + ''vagal'' "wandering") is a collection of unproven, evolutionary, neuroscientific, and psychological constructs pertaining to the role of the [[vagus nerve]] in emotion regulation, social connection and fear response, introduced in 1994 by [[Stephen Porges]]. 

*Yes, the characterization as “unproven” should remain in the lead.

*In part. Different language should be used in the lead to reflect criticism of the theory from the body of the article.

*No, the characterization should be removed. 

[[User:Ian Oelsner|Ian Oelsner]] ([[User talk:Ian Oelsner|talk]]) 23:16, 16 August 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Bryan Johnson (entrepreneur)#rfc_6647098|Talk:Bryan Johnson (entrepreneur)]] expired 2023-09-16 18:01 ===
* Id: 6647098
* User: Vontheri
* Date: 2023-08-17 17:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1170869917|BIO 1170869917}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1175683579|BIO 1175683579}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There has been a discussion at [[Talk:Bryan Johnson (entrepreneur)#Why were my edits reverted?|this talk page]] as to whether or not the life-extension practices of [[Bryan Johnson (entrepreneur)]] should be mentioned in the article. Given that it is what he is most known for by the general public and media, I feel as though it would make the article incomplete to not include it, as long as his practices are described neutrally and not in a way that implies endorsement. Excluding it could also violate [[WP:NPOV]], which states, "the neutral point of view does not mean the exclusion of certain points of view." The other editor, @[[User:Bon courage|Bon courage]], feels as though it is too fringe to include and that it cannot be properly contextualized. A third editor, @[[user:Psychologist Guy]], has also given some input. It would be appreciated if others could give their input. Thanks! [[User:Vontheri|Vontheri]] ([[User talk:Vontheri|talk]]) 17:51, 17 August 2023 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1175973758|SCI 1175973758}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1175998786|SCI 1175998786}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1175998790|STYLE 1175998790}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the term "quackery" be used in the lede for acupuncture? The term pseudoscience is already used and it has been described as non-scientific in that same paragraph/sentence. Does using the term 'quackery' provide additional information that is not already there, or is it making a value-based call that compromises the neutrality of an encyclopedia? [[User:CranberryMuffin|CranberryMuffin]] ([[User talk:CranberryMuffin|talk]]) 16:57, 18 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Felony#rfc_D2A2495|Talk:Felony]] expired 2023-09-21 00:01 ===
* Id: D2A2495
* User: Rockstone35
* Date: 2023-09-08 05:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1174399396|POL 1174399396}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1176323211|POL 1176323211}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It is unclear if this article should use American (e.g. "offense") or British (e.g., "offence") spelling. It is currently using a mixture of both, which violates the the manual of style's requirement for consistency. The [[special:permanentLink/252241|original version of the article]], from 2001, also used a mixture of both, so [[MOS:RETAIN]] doesn't seem to help. --[[User:Rockstone35|<span style="color:#DF0101"><b>Rockstone</b></span>]][[User talk:Rockstone35|<span style="color:0000ff;font-size:15px"><sup><small><b>Send me a message!</b></small></sup></span>]] 05:51, 8 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_AA0F2CD|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2023-09-21 02:01 ===
* Id: AA0F2CD
* User: Sdkb
* Date: 2023-08-29 00:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1172743205|PROP 1172743205}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1177537063|PROP 1177537063}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Which level of [[WP:UPLOAD-P|<u>Upload</u>-protection]] should be applied to Wikipedia-hosted images that appear in the lead section of an article appearing as [[WP:TFA|Today's Featured Article]] from the day before it appears on the Main Page through the day after?
* '''Option 1''': No change (which defaults to the normal requirement that image uploaders be [[WP:AUTOCONFIRM|autoconfirmed]])
* '''Option 2''': [[WP:ECP|Extended-confirmed protection]] (500 edits/30 days)
* '''Option 3''': [[WP:Full|Full-protection]] (only administrators)

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we include in this article the section "Intermixing with the Slavs"? [[Talk:Vikings#About the section "intermixing with the Slavs"|As I stated in the previous section]], I am the author of that paragraph, and I originally made it as a hoax. It was the only bad faith edit I made, and I am surprised it made it this far. I don't want to have burdens on my conscience, I learned to be objective and that stuff just can't stay in any article. It is WP:OR mixed with POV-pushing and extraordinary claims.[[User:Viking123456789|Viking123456789]] ([[User talk:Viking123456789|talk]]) 20:00, 24 August 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Solitaire#rfc_4C40427|Talk:Solitaire]] expired 2023-09-24 16:01 ===
* Id: 4C40427
* User: Onceinawhile
* Date: 2023-08-25 15:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1172199421|SOC 1172199421}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1176882893|SOC 1176882893}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article has been problematic for twelve years. Initially it had the scope of our current [[Patience (game)]] article. In 2011 an editor without consensus split content from here to create the Patience article, leaving a dictionary definition article stub at this title.[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk%3ASolitaire&diff=413063745&oldid=365867969][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Solitaire&diff=413096394&oldid=407687494][https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Patience_(game)&oldid=413061972] Since then there have been various attempts to fix it through discussion, notably [[Talk:Patience (game)#Requested move 4 March 2018|in 2018]], [[Talk:Solitaire_(disambiguation)#Requested_move_7_December_2019|in 2019]] and [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Solitaire|in 2023]], all of which failed. 

In this context, please comment on what the right scope for this article should be. Discussion so far (above) has been stuck between three editors with differing views: one who thinks the scope is "games called solitaire", one who thinks it is "all one-player tabletop games", and me who thinks it is currently about the term solitaire and thus should be at wiktionary. Note that after two months of discussion, no sources have yet been brought to adequately cover any of these three potential scopes, so editors bringing sources with their comments would be greatly appreciated.

[[User:Onceinawhile|Onceinawhile]] ([[User talk:Onceinawhile|talk]]) 15:44, 25 August 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Tiffany Young#rfc_B2B1152|Talk:Tiffany Young]] expired 2023-09-27 14:01 ===
* Id: B2B1152
* User: Paper9oll
* Date: 2023-08-28 13:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1172662103|BIO 1172662103}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1177414894|BIO 1177414894}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There has been dispute pertaining the first sentence on the lead on whether to include ethnicity or removing it. Previous consensus [[Talk:Tiffany Young/Archive 1#American vs Korean-American?|here]] was in favor of including her ethnicity in the lead section mainly due to relevant to the subject's notability. However, as of today, we have yet another dilemma where another group of editors (whom didn't participated previously) were in favor of removing it hence we need to fix it once and for all (this can't kept going on where more than 6 months later, another group wanted it back) and agree on what is what, lets !vote.

Which options is your preferred !vote:
# Stephanie Young Hwang (born August 1, 1989), known professionally as Tiffany or Tiffany Young, is an American singer-songwriter of Korean descent.
# Stephanie Young Hwang (born August 1, 1989), known professionally as Tiffany or Tiffany Young, is an American singer-songwriter based in South Korea.
# Stephanie Young Hwang (born August 1, 1989), known professionally as Tiffany or Tiffany Young, is an American-born Korean singer-songwriter.
# Stephanie Young Hwang (born August 1, 1989), known professionally as Tiffany or Tiffany Young, is an American singer-songwriter.
# Stephanie Young Hwang (born August 1, 1989), known professionally as Tiffany or Tiffany Young, is an American and Korean singer-songwriter.

'''<span style="color:#f535aa">—</span> [[User:Paper9oll|<span style="background:#f535aa;color:#fff;padding:2px;border-radius:5px">Paper9oll</span>]] <span style="color:#f535aa">([[User talk:Paper9oll|🔔]] • [[Special:Contributions/Paper9oll|📝]])</span>''' 13:27, 28 August 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:HIStory World Tour#rfc_F9A5DD1|Talk:HIStory World Tour]] expired 2023-09-28 09:02 ===
* Id: F9A5DD1
* User: HorrorLover555
* Date: 2023-09-28 07:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1177580194|MEDIA 1177580194}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1177580196|POL 1177580196}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1177587058|MEDIA 1177587058}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1177587060|POL 1177587060}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Dear Editors of the HIStory World Tour,

I hope this message finds you well. I recently reviewed the information related to the HIStory World Tour and came across a minor error, particularly in the section detailing the tour dates. I would like to propose a correction to ensure the accuracy of our records. In the tour dates section, it is mentioned that Michael Jackson visited "Taiwan" during his Asian tour. While he did indeed perform there, it is important to note that, according to the general consensus of the international community, Taiwan is not an independent country. Therefore, I suggest amending "Taiwan" to "People's Republic of China" to accurately reflect this fact. I understand that many sources on the internet may refer to Taiwan due to their focus on the performance location rather than geopolitical issues. Additionally, given certain Western influences attempting to divide China, some malicious media outlets may intentionally refer to Taiwan as an independent country. However, as a free and open wiki website, we have a responsibility to ensure the accuracy of information and inform people that Michael Jackson visited what is officially recognized as Chinese Taiwan. I can provide numerous reputable sources, including official statements from the United States government and relevant United Nations documents, to support the assertion that Taiwan is an integral part of China. These sources explicitly state that Taiwan is a province of China. I appreciate your dedicated work and hope that this suggestion will help ensure the accuracy of our tour information. If further discussion or assistance is needed, please do not hesitate to contact me.  
:He did perform in Taiwan though, and there are multiple sources that say that "he performed in Taiwan", like these sources [https://www.google.ca/books/edition/Michael_Jackson_FAQ/BKlZCwAAQBAJ?hl=en&gbpv=1&dq=michael+jackson+taiwan+1996&pg=PT433&printsec=frontcover here], [https://books.google.ca/books?id=kDgDAAAAMBAJ&pg=PA62&dq=michael+jackson+taiwan+1996+history&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwi27bbU48yBAxXjvokEHfgPDbcQ6AF6BAgFEAI#v=onepage&q=michael%20jackson%20taiwan%201996%20history&f=false here] and [https://books.google.ca/books?id=FGYVAAAAIBAJ&pg=PA27&dq=michael+jackson+taiwan+1996+history&article_id=1675,3618942&hl=en&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwj00Lzq48yBAxVZjYkEHdRcBCEQ6AF6BAgNEAI#v=onepage&q=michael%20jackson%20taiwan%201996%20history&f=false here]. [[User:HorrorLover555|HorrorLover555]] ([[User talk:HorrorLover555|talk]]) 07:27, 28 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:What Is a Woman?#rfc_280A7DD|Talk:What Is a Woman?]] expired 2023-09-28 14:01 ===
* Id: 280A7DD
* User: FMSky
* Date: 2023-09-17 12:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1175779128|MEDIA 1175779128}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I want to gain consensus to add the following to the lead. Previous discussion didnt lead to anything:
{{blockquote|''What Is a Woman?'' is a 2022 American online film about [[gender]] and [[transgender]] issues presented by [[Conservatism in the United States|conservative]] political commentator [[Matt Walsh (political commentator)|Matt Walsh]]. The film was released by conservative website ''[[The Daily Wire]]'', with direction by Justin Folk. In the film, Walsh asks various people "What is a woman?", '''which most of the interviewees are unable to answer.'''<ref name=":1">{{Cite web |last=Burkhardt|first=Kai|date=August 29, 2022 |title='Die einfache Frage, die Amerikas Gender-Experten in die Verzweiflung treibt' |url=https://www.welt.de/kultur/plus240608479/What-is-a-Woman-Wie-Matt-Walsh-Amerikas-Gender-Krieg-aufrollt.html |access-date=August 31, 2022 |website=[[Die Welt]]}}</ref><ref name=":2">{{Cite web |last=Schneible |first=Ann |date=July 27, 2022 |title='What Is a Woman?' |url=https://www.ncregister.com/news/what-is-a-woman?amp |access-date=August 6, 2022 |website=[[National Catholic Register]]}}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.spiked-online.com/2023/06/06/what-is-a-woman-and-the-rise-of-liberal-intolerance/ | title=What is a Woman? And the rise of liberal intolerance }}</ref><ref>{{cite web | url=https://www.washingtonexaminer.com/restoring-america/fairness-justice/what-is-a-woman-question-courts-afraid-to-answer | title=What is a woman? A question even the courts are afraid to answer | date=28 August 2023 }}</ref>}} (or similar wording)
--[[User:FMSky|FMSky]] ([[User talk:FMSky|talk]]) 12:54, 17 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Nondualism#rfc_9B025EE|Talk:Nondualism]] expired 2023-09-29 01:01 ===
* Id: 9B025EE
* User: Skyerise
* Date: 2023-08-30 00:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1172897475|RELI 1172897475}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1177698744|RELI 1177698744}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The old lead is full of problems, the primary one being its non-accessibility to the average reader, overuse of technical jargon, and trying to define a concept differently defined by different traditions, calling it "fuzzy". I propose to replace it with:

{{quote|'''Nondualism''' includes a number of philosophical and spiritual traditions that emphasize the absence of fundamental duality or separation in existence.{{sfn|Loy|1997|pp=178, 185}} This viewpoint questions the boundaries conventionally imposed between self and other, mind and body, observer and observed,{{sfn|Loy|1997}} and other dichotomies that shape our perception of reality. As a field of study, nondualism delves into the concept of '''nonduality'''{{sfn|Loy|1997}} and the state of '''nondual awareness''',{{sfn|Hanley|Nakamura|Garland|2018}}{{sfn|Josipovic|2019}} encompassing a diverse array of interpretations across traditions, not limited to a particular cultural or religious context; instead, nondualism emerges as a central teaching across various traditions, inviting individuals to examine reality beyond the confines of dualistic thinking.

What sets nondualism apart is its inclination towards [[direct experience]] as a path to [[understanding]]. While [[Intellectualism|intellectual comprehension]] has its place, nondual traditions emphasize the [[Spiritual transformation|transformative power]] of firsthand encounters with the underlying unity of existence. Through practices like [[meditation]] and self-inquiry, practitioners aim to bypass the limitations of [[Conceptual model|conceptual understanding]] and directly apprehend the interconnectedness that transcends superficial distinctions.{{sfn|Grimes|1996|p=15}} This experiential aspect of nondualism challenges the limitations of [[language]] and [[rational thought]], aiming for a more immediate, [[Intuition|intuitive]] form of knowledge.

Nondualism is distinct from [[monism]],<ref>Roberts, M. V. (2010). ''Dualities: A Theology of Difference''. Presbyterian Publishing Corporation. {{isbn|9780664234492}}. p. 21. Discusses why Advaita Vedanta is nondual while Kashmir Shaivism is monist.</ref> another philosophical concept that deals with the [[Nature (philosophy)|nature]] of [[reality]]. While both philosophies challenge the conventional understanding of dualism, they approach it differently. Nondualism emphasizes unity amid diversity. In contrast, monism posits that reality is ultimately [[symbol grounding problem|grounded]] in a [[Monad (philosophy)|singular substance or principle]], reducing the multiplicity of existence to a singular foundation. The distinction lies in their approach to the relationship between the [[Neither one nor many|many and the one]].<ref>Bowes, P. (2021). ''The Hindu Religious Tradition: A Philosophical Approach''. Taylor & Francis. {{ISBN|9781000216097}} "There is a subtle difference in philosophical implications of these two terms 'monism' and 'non-dualism'. 'Monism' may be thought to have a numerical implication, one as against the many, and here unity may appear to be numerical. 'Non-dualism' has no numerical implication, things are not different from one another, or not two, from the point of view of seeing the divine essence present in all things, but their numerical manyness need not be in question in any way. The Upanisads concern themselves with the non-dual divine essence of the universe, but they in no way reject the numerical manyness in order to preach non-dualism."</ref>

Each nondual tradition presents unique interpretations of nonduality. [[Advaita Vedanta]], a school of thought within [[Hinduism]], focuses on the realization of the unity between the individual self ([[Ātman (Hinduism)|Ātman]]) and the ultimate reality ([[Brahman]]).{{sfn|Loy|2012|p=17}} In [[Zen Buddhism]], the emphasis is on the direct experience of interconnectedness that goes beyond conventional thought constructs. [[Dzogchen]], found in [[Tibetan Buddhism]], highlights the recognition of an innate nature free from dualistic limitations.{{sfnp|McCagney|1997|pp=40–41}} This diversity of perspectives reflects the richness of nondualism, which transcends binary perceptions and offers unique insights into the fundamental nature of reality.}}

This is a much more accessible lead, easier to understand for the average reader, distinguishes and nondualism from monism, which the current article fails to do. [[User:Skyerise|Skyerise]] ([[User talk:Skyerise|talk]]) 00:16, 30 August 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_12CF5F8|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2023-09-29 20:01 ===
* Id: 12CF5F8
* User: Cambalachero
* Date: 2023-09-26 18:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1177217954|MEDIA 1177217954}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1177819601|MEDIA 1177819601}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[La Izquierda Diario]] ("'The left' newspaper) is an online newspaper from Argentina. It is owned by the [[Socialist Workers' Party (Argentina)|Socialist Workers' Party]], and as such it is a [[WP:BIASED|biased source]]. We may still use it with attribution, but to what end? This is a really minor and almost irrelevant party. It is part of the [[Workers' Left Front]] coalition ("Frente de Izquierda y de trabajadores"), which only got 2.65% of the vote on the last elections (see [https://resultados.gob.ar/elecciones/1/0/1/-1/-1 here]). Their opinions are hardly relevant for any article, except those about themselves. Note that the article says "La Izquierda Diario has been credited for gaining a non-Trotskyite reader base among the left.", but the reference is not really a good one: it is a magazine detailing the profile of one of their own columnists, who happens to work at that other newspaper as well. If we check independent sources, [https://www.infobae.com/sociedad/2022/06/14/cuales-son-los-medios-que-mas-se-consumen-en-la-argentina/ here] is a report of the most consumed media in Argentina, including online media. It lists the top 16 ones, and La Izquierda Diario is not even mentioned. It does not have any noticeable reader base, Trotskyite or otherwise. 

In short, this newspaper '''belongs''' to a political party, which makes it a biased source by default (and you can always read any random article to confirm their left-wing bias), and that party is of borderline significance. I request to consider it "''Generally unreliable''" in articles about politics of Argentina. [[User:Cambalachero|Cambalachero]] ([[User talk:Cambalachero|talk]]) 18:12, 26 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Moscow Uprising (1611)#rfc_33C4CD3|Talk:Moscow Uprising (1611)]] expired 2023-09-30 17:01 ===
* Id: 33C4CD3
* User: Crop stuff
* Date: 2023-09-29 14:36:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1177780893|HIST 1177780893}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1177945762|HIST 1177945762}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The article mentions a massacre orchestrated by the Poles during the Moscow Uprising of 1611, with an estimated casualty figure of 6-7 thousand Muscovites. 

This information is sourced from an article on press.lv, which states: 'По подсчетам современных историков, во время восстания погибли примерно 7 тыс. горожан.' ('According to the calculations of modern historians, about 7 thousand citizens died during the uprising.'). 

However, the referenced article does not provide a link to any research by historians substantiating this figure. 

Moreover, the press.lv article is a re-publication of another piece from aif.ru titled 'Московская резня 1611 г. Как впервые была сказана фраза «шапками закидаем»' ('The Moscow Massacre of 1611. When was the phrase 'we will throw hats on' first said'). The aif.ru article, too, lacks reference to any research, and its author (profile: <nowiki>https://aif.ru/opinion/author/358</nowiki>) is not a historian. 

Hence, the casualty figure of 6-7 thousand cited in the article remains unverified, and the source appears to be of low credibility.
 [[User:Crop stuff|Crop stuff]] ([[User talk:Crop stuff|talk]]) 14:36, 29 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2023 Israeli judicial reform protests#rfc_68BD417|Talk:2023 Israeli judicial reform protests]] expired 2023-10-02 11:01 ===
* Id: 68BD417
* User: Makeandtoss
* Date: 2023-09-25 13:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1177028463|POL 1177028463}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1178234381|POL 1178234381}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Does this content in the quote belong to the "Connection to the Palestinian issue" section?

I am unaware of any Wikipedia guidelines that prevent the addition of findings by leading human rights organizations. Furthermore, articles about protests in Wikipedia are quite exhuastive, including [[George Floyd protests]], which has dedicated sections for conspiracy theories, public art, and economic impact. 
{{cquote|On 13 September 2023, [[Amnesty International]] published an article arguing that Israel's judicial overhaul has "alarming" implications for human rights, especially for Palestinians. It stated that Israel's judiciary, mainly its Supreme Court, has regularly upheld policies, practices and laws that helped enforce "Israel's system of apartheid against Palestinians". The article named examples of the role the Supreme Court played against Palestinians: upholding administrative detentions, green-lighting the destruction of villages, upholding a law imposing restrictions on family reunification. Amnesty argued that the Supreme Court intervened in protecting Palestinian human rights on few occasions, but if the institution loses power to the government, even this "slim and inconsistent" protection would disappear.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2023/09/defending-the-rule-of-law-enforcing-apartheid-the-double-life-of-israels-judiciary/|title=Defending the rule of law, enforcing apartheid – the double life of Israel’s judiciary|work=Amnesty International|date=13 September 2023|accessdate=23 September 2023}}</ref>}} [[User:Makeandtoss|Makeandtoss]] ([[User talk:Makeandtoss|talk]]) 13:50, 25 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of Marvel Cinematic Universe television series#rfc_A705BCB|Talk:List of Marvel Cinematic Universe television series]] expired 2023-10-04 23:01 ===
* Id: A705BCB
* User: ChimaFan12
* Date: 2023-09-09 22:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1174662827|MEDIA 1174662827}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1179400423|MEDIA 1179400423}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Adventure into Fear was a planned programming block for Hulu before it was cancelled, with sources conflicting on whether it would be tied to Agents of SHIELD at the time and with no source marketing the show as part of the MCU. The sole show produced for it, ''Helstrom'', [https://www.looper.com/263165/why-helstroms-showrunner-is-happy-its-not-part-of-the-mcu-exclusive/ was described by its showrunner as being] "not part of the MCU" or its canon, and saying that its exclusion from the MCU allowed the creative team to "focus on our people, our characters, our story." As this list is exclusively for series that are part of the MCU, would there be support for removing all information regarding Adventure into Fear from this page and leaving [[Adventure_into_Fear_(franchise)|a link to that page]] (which will have all relevant information added) in the See Also section? [[User:ChimaFan12|ChimaFan12]] ([[User talk:ChimaFan12|talk]]) 22:01, 9 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (royalty and nobility)#rfc_4C3CE43|Wikipedia talk:Naming conventions (royalty and nobility)]] expired 2023-10-05 08:01 ===
* Id: 4C3CE43
* User: Surtsicna
* Date: 2023-09-05 07:50:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1173931652|STYLE 1173931652}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1178694199|STYLE 1178694199}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For over a decade now the titles of articles about British monarchs have been at [[Elizabeth II]], [[George VI]], [[Edward VIII]], etc. Likewise it has been 13 years since [[Maria Theresa of Austria]] was moved to [[Maria Theresa]] <small>([[Talk:Maria_Theresa/Archive_1#Requested_move_2|discussion]])</small> and [[Louis-Philippe I of France]] to [[Louis-Philippe I]] <small>([[Talk:Louis_Philippe_I/Archive_1#Requested_move|discussion]])</small>, longer still since [[Napoleon I of France]] was abandoned for [[Napoleon]]. Three years ago the country qualifiers were dropped for titles such as [[Juan Carlos I]] and others <small>([[Talk:Amadeo_I_of_Spain#Requested_move_20_August_2020|discussion]])</small>, [[Carl XVI Gustaf]] and others <small>([[Talk:Carl_XVI_Gustaf/Archive_2#Requested_move_9_June_2020|discussion]])</small>, [[Elizabeth I]] <small>([[Talk:Elizabeth_I/Archive_4#Requested_move_25_May_2020|discussion]])</small> and others, [[Louis XIV]] and others <small>([[Talk:Louis_XIV/Archive_3#Requested_move_21_June_2020|discussion]])</small>, etc.

This year multiple attempts to move articles back to the Name Number of Country format failed: [[Alfonso XIII]] to [[Alfonso XIII of Spain]] and similar <small>([[Talk:Alfonso_XII#Requested_move_30_March_2023|discussion]])</small>, [[Napoleon III]] to [[Napoleon III of France]] and similar <small>([[Talk:Charles_the_Bald#Requested_move_31_July_2023|discussion]])</small>,  [[Elizabeth II]] to [[Elizabeth II of the United Kingdom]] and similar <small>([[Talk:Elizabeth_II/Archive_48#Requested_move_30_July_2023|discussion]])</small>

Should a point be added to [[WP:SOVEREIGNS]] to reflect these changes and explicitly endorse the use of shorter titles where no disambiguation is needed?  [[User:Surtsicna|Surtsicna]] ([[User talk:Surtsicna|talk]]) [[User:Surtsicna|Surtsicna]] ([[User talk:Surtsicna|talk]]) 07:50, 5 September 2023 (UTC)}}

Which of the following ideas should be the guiding one for inclusion in "Main Year articles", like [[2023]] and [[1992]]?
*'''Option A''' – Each event has its own consensus, as guided by [[WP:DUE]] and coverage
*'''Option B''' – Only events that significantly affect multiple countries. ''International Notability'', exclude all "domestic" events.

*'''Option D''' – Use the inclusion criteria as described in the essay [[WP:Recent years]].

=== [[Talk:Withania somnifera#rfc_DA1B612|Talk:Withania somnifera]] expired 2023-10-08 06:01 ===
* Id: DA1B612
* User: Zefr
* Date: 2023-10-08 04:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1179140965|SCI 1179140965}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1179145657|SCI 1179145657}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 Requesting separate objective input on the following question: does ''Phytotherapy Research'' meet Wikipedia standards for reliability? It is a peer-reviewed journal with an impact factor of 6.338. By user Ashwinr, 8 October 2023.
:That information does not address the issue discussed above: ''Phytotherapy Research'' is not a reliable source <u>for medical content</u>, as it meets no [[WP:MEDRS]] standards - see [[WP:MEDASSESS]] pyramids for the quality of evidence needed to support medical content. High-quality reviews of [[Phases_of_clinical_research#Phase_III|Phase III clinical trials]] do not appear in ''Phytotherapy Research'' because there are no such trials on ''W. somnifera'' to review - the existing trials are all rudimentary and low-quality with design and compliance problems, as commonly mentioned by the authors. ''Phytotherapy Research'' publications do not guide national clinical organizations for their recommendations about using ''W. somnifera'' for treating any supposed medical disorder (because no such recommendations exist), and do not influence national regulatory agencies about approving ''W. somnifera'' as a drug (''W. somnifera'' is not approved for treating anything). An acceptable source would be  "medical guidelines or position statements by internationally or nationally recognized expert bodies also often contain recommendations, along with assessments of underlying evidence" (from MEDASSESS) or a Cochrane review.
:The concluson is that ''Phytotherapy Research'' publications on ''W. somnifera'' are preliminary at best, and too low-quality to imply an effect on any physiological mechanism or clinical disorder. [[User:Zefr|Zefr]] ([[User talk:Zefr|talk]]) 04:25, 8 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Danny Masterson#rfc_AADFBBF|Talk:Danny Masterson]] expired 2023-10-08 10:01 ===
* Id: AADFBBF
* Date: 2023-09-08 09:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1174421902|BIO 1174421902}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1179166987|BIO 1179166987}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Situation:''' The subject of this [[WP:BLP|BLP]], Danny Masterson, was convicted of rape several months ago, and sentenced just yesterday. Numerous editors have added "rapist" or "sex offender" or "convicted" to the first sentence of the lead paragraph and the short description, and other editors have removed those labels. The article has been rapidly fluctuating back and forth, and an earlier discussion on the talk page hasn't resolved the issue.

'''Question:''' Should any of the above ''terms'' be included, or not-included, in the lead paragraph, lead sentence, and/or the short description? <u>'''Clarification:''' The question is referring to the use of the ''labels'' themselves, not referring to sentences describing the concept. </u>

'''Relevant guidelines:''' [[WP:Manual of Style/Lead section]], especially the sections [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Lead section#Opening paragraph|Opening paragraph]], [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Lead section#First sentence|First sentence]], [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Lead section#Biographies|Biographies]], and [[Wikipedia:Manual of Style/Lead section#Biographies' first sentence|Biographies' first sentence]].

09:08, 8 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_35BE3D8|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2023-10-08 12:01 ===
* Id: 35BE3D8
* User: FOARP
* Date: 2023-09-15 16:22:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1175603908|POLICY 1175603908}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1179177862|POLICY 1179177862}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Regarding the section "[[WP:GEOLAND|Settlements and administrative regions]]" of the notability guide for geographical features ([[WP:NGEO]]), which of the following should we do?:
* '''Option 1''': Status quo. Leave it as it is
* '''Option 2''': Replace the "Settlements and administrative regions" section with:
::'''Settlements''' and '''administrative regions''' are typically presumed notable, provided information about them beyond statistics, region, and coordinates is [[WP:BURDEN|known to exist]]. The extent of coverage in secondary sources should be considered to ensure there is enough verifiable content for an encyclopedic article. Editors should avoid creating very short articles on these topics, e.g., "Village X is in County Y, Province Z of Country A, at coordinates C, with a population of P." is not enough content for a stand-alone article.

::If a Wikipedia article on a settlement or [[administrative region]] cannot be developed using known sources, information on it should instead be included in a more general article on a higher-level administrative region, or in a list article collecting information on similar settlements or regions (per the [[WP:NLIST|list notability criteria]] and [[Wikipedia:Stand-alone lists#all not notable|common list selection criteria #2]]). 

::This criterion applies to settlements and administrative regions including states, provinces, municipalities, districts, parishes, counties,  cities, villages, towns, and their equivalents, that provide general-purpose administration for their region, regardless of whether they presently exist or [[WP:NTEMP|are abandoned]], even if their population is low. It does not apply to special-purpose districts such as census tracts, irrigation districts, library districts, etc. which should instead be assessed on a case-by-case basis according to the [[general notability guideline]].
:This change to be made in combination with the amonishment that editors should avoid flooding AFD with articles (e.g., more than 10 nominations  per day as with [[Wikipedia_talk:Notability_(astronomical_objects)/Archive_4#Proposed_changes|minor planets]]) that fail the amended guide. [[User:FOARP|FOARP]] ([[User talk:FOARP|talk]]) 16:22, 15 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Ballon d'Or#rfc_EC637E9|Talk:Ballon d'Or]] expired 2023-10-08 15:01 ===
* Id: EC637E9
* User: Dawid2009
* Date: 2023-09-08 14:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1174454093|SOC 1174454093}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the term "'''most points in Ballon d Or history''' used in the article or there is consensus that there are no reliable sources on that and it is just original research intepretation of some journalist? While it is no surprise many IP or rare users add trivial stats to articles about Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi then I was shocked when [[User:PeeJay]] (experienced editor) restored this [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Ballon_d%27Or&diff=prev&oldid=1165974995 thing]. Khelnow.com is not reliable source an that [https://khelnow.com/football/top-10-players-most-ballon-dor-votes-in-history system of points] does not make any sense. France football never make any officlal list of most points in history but if new term "most Ballon d r points in history" has been introduced then Messi would have more points than Cristiano Ronaldo and Johan Cruyff would have more than Modric. Back then there were much less !voters in that, although players could achieve certain places then they did not receive a lot of points: [https://twitter.com/avisualgame/status/1607776382490222593 that is the problem]. As France Football (or any other organisation as UEFFA or at least other reliable source) never published rnking with proper analyse there is no need to add such [[WP:NOTSTATS]]. Additionally it is featured article so that not reliable fake information about most points in history could butcher and disgrace the article. It does not make any sense if for [[1956 Ballon d'Or]] first place holder had 47 points and for [[2021 Ballon d'Or]] 9-th place holder had 58 points, in [[2014 FIFA Ballon d'Or]] as points were "percentages, meanwhile in [[2022 Ballon d'Or]] points were hidden, etc., so total mix up and, so big disapointed that not verifited thing was ever added to Wikipedia and yet resorted.  [[User:Dawid2009|Dawid2009]] ([[User talk:Dawid2009|talk]]) 14:58, 8 September 2023 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1175052888|STYLE 1175052888}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1179268972|STYLE 1179268972}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The term "LGBT" (which stands for "lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender") is quite ubiquitous, and it may be safe to think that everybody knows what does it stand for with no need to explicitly clarify it. [[User:Cambalachero|Cambalachero]] ([[User talk:Cambalachero|talk]]) 13:59, 12 September 2023 (UTC)}}

'''B''' - Include only one section for "Swiss Federal Councillor" with lines to show years served as President/Vice President (see this old revision [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Alain_Berset&oldid=1129250199]); or <br>

=== [[Talk:Persian Gulf#rfc_8A02B90|Talk:Persian Gulf]] expired 2023-10-21 13:01 ===
* Id: 8A02B90
* User: Amirmm0
* Date: 2023-10-21 11:29:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1181185912|HIST 1181185912}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1181191212|HIST 1181191212}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I wonder why is it this much normalized to consider a racist name as an alternative name for Persian Gulf. Persian Gulf is an international body of water and is not a part of Iranian territory. So, when it is called by its standard name, there is no racial meaning in this context. it's not even related to Iran. It's simply a name.
But when you call it Arabian, it is no more a simple name. you are giving it a racial meaning.
Let me make another example: Consider the Indian Ocean. While we call it the Indian Ocean, it's simply a name with no racial context. but what if we call it "Iranian Ocean"? Aren't we giving it racial meaning in this way? Doesn't it mean we are expressing hate against Indians? The ocean is right there as an international water and is not a part of Indian territory and its name presents no racial meaning, But if we call it Iranian, then it will be different.

So I am saying.. there is no middle ground here. You can not say I will respect both sides. You are either using a simple name that is not related to Iranians or any other race  OR you are a racist and a pro Pan-Arabism who is expressing hate against Iranians. So, using 'argumentum ad temperantiam' here means you are the latter. That's it. 

Using a racist alternative for the name of Persian Gulf would be against the neutral view policy of Wikipedia. The only neutral name here is Persian Gulf.
The 'Arabian' name is not simply incorrect. It's not neutral. The racist name  as an alternative should be removed, as we wouldn't use n-word as alternative for black although its use is prevalent. The modern naming dispute can be instead described in a separate section inside the article.[[User:Amirmm0|Amirmm0]] ([[User talk:Amirmm0|talk]]) 11:29, 21 October 2023 (UTC)}}

 Should the hatnote include a link to [[Valve Corporation]]? 13:34, 21 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Environmental Working Group#rfc_4A3FC04|Talk:Environmental Working Group]] expired 2023-10-21 19:01 ===
* Id: 4A3FC04
* User: Gtoffoletto
* Date: 2023-09-21 18:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1176441215|SCI 1176441215}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Per the above discussion I propose that we add a section covering PFAS advocacy in a dedicated section and then expand it as necessary.

Here is a possible text with sources:

Title: '''{{tq|PFAS regulation advocacy}}''' 

Content: {{tq|Since the early 2000s, EWG has conducted research and has been advocating for increasing regulations on the use of [[Per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances|Per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS)]].[https://www.berghahnjournals.com/view/journals/environment-and-society/12/1/ares120109.xml][https://www.cbsnews.com/news/drinking-water-may-contain-pfas-chemicals-in-43-states-according-to-new-study-by-environmental-working-group/][https://www.nytimes.com/2022/08/18/science/pfas-forever-chemicals.html] EWG has collaborated with the Social Science Environmental Health Research Institute (SSEHRI) at [[Northeastern University]] to publish a map showing detections of PFAS in water samples across the USA.[https://www.berghahnjournals.com/view/journals/environment-and-society/12/1/ares120109.xml][https://www.cbsnews.com/news/drinking-water-may-contain-pfas-chemicals-in-43-states-according-to-new-study-by-environmental-working-group/]}} <span style="color:#AAA"><small><nowiki>&#123;{u&#124;</nowiki></small>[[User:Gtoffoletto|<span style="color:darkGreen;font-weight:bold">Gtoffoletto</span>]]<small><nowiki>&#125;}</nowiki></small></span>  <sup>[[User talk:Gtoffoletto|'''talk''']]</sup> 18:31, 21 September 2023 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Please see [[Help:Disambiguation]] as this article has since creation caused potential issues due to band borrowing name of a geographical feature. I have confirmed that at least since 2019 when nodule mining controversy started heating up disambiguation approach appears appropriate given mentions of geological feature in other articles in wikipedia. I suggest permanent solution by creation of disambiguation page [[Clarion Fracture Zone]] after move of this article to [[Clarion Fracture Zone (band)]] and for the moment at least, the rather large but uninteresting for most geological feature on the Pacific Ocean seafloor redirect from [[Clarion Fracture Zone (geology)]] to [[Clipperton Fracture Zone]] [[User:ChaseKiwi|ChaseKiwi]] ([[User talk:ChaseKiwi|talk]]) 11:16, 22 October 2023 (UTC)}}

Should the [[United States]] be added to the infobox as a belligerent?

*'''Option 1''' — Yes (Listed as flag under Israel - No additional info - Full belligerent)

*'''Option 3''' — Yes (Listed as a bullet point under Israel as “''United States (in Iraq and Red Sea only)'“
*'''Option 4''' — Yes (Listed under a “Supported by” subheading under Israel. <small>(Note, this format was previously deprecated and is not used without consensus agreeing on it’s use.)</small>
*'''Option 5''' — Yes (Format not mentioned in option 1-4)
*'''Option 6''' — No

'''The [[User:WeatherWriter|Weather Event Writer]]''' ([[User talk:WeatherWriter|Talk Page)]] 16:19, 24 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of major terrorist incidents#rfc_0335FE6|Talk:List of major terrorist incidents]] expired 2023-10-24 19:01 ===
* Id: 0335FE6
* User: François Robere
* Date: 2023-10-13 14:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1181675843|UNSORTED 1181675843}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1181709348|UNSORTED 1181709348}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
{{Not a ballot}}
* '''Yes'''. For an entry to be added to the list, it must be a "major terrorist incident conducted by violent non-state actors":
<ol>
<li> "'''Terrorist incident'''": many RS qualify this as a terrorist attack ''in their own voice'':
{{collapse|
* "Wie sind die Terroristen vorgegangen?" ("How did the terrorists do it?") - [https://www.sueddeutsche.de/projekte/artikel/politik/israel-hamas-gaza-rekonstruktion-e845071/ Süddeutsche Zeitung]
* "Shock Hamas terror attack" - [https://www.france24.com/en/middle-east/20231011-shock-hamas-terror-attack-the-beginning-of-the-end-for-israel-s-netanyahu France 24]
* "a campaign of terror" - [https://www.foreignaffairs.com/israel/war-hamas-always-wanted Foreign Affairs]
* "The Hamas terrorist offensive" - [https://www.cnbc.com/2023/10/11/live-updates-latest-news-on-gaza-and-israel-hamas-conflict.html CNBC]
* "Hamas' bloody terror attack" - [https://www.cbsnews.com/live-updates/israel-hamas-palestinian-war-attacks-gaza-strip/ CBS]
* "a campaign of terror" - [https://www.politico.eu/article/israel-hamas-war-gaza-kidnapping-survivor-kibbutz-baby-killed/ Politico]
* "massacre of civilians by Hamas terrorists" - [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/10/10/world/middleeast/israel-gaza-war-hamas-deaths-killings.html NYT]
* "Hamas terrorist attacks" - [https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/world/2023/10/10/iran-hamas-terrorist-attacks-kidnappings-israel/71121822007/ USA Today]
* "massacre of Israelis at the hands of Hamas terrorists" - [https://www.itv.com/news/2023-10-10/joe-biden-calls-hamas-actions-pure-unadulterated-evil-in-defence-of-israel ITV]
* "terrorists in Gaza", "terror attacks" - [https://www.pbs.org/newshour/show/fears-of-bigger-war-grow-as-israel-hamas-fighting-continues-after-surprise-attack PBS]
* "a terror attack" - [https://edition.cnn.com/2023/10/09/middleeast/israel-hamas-gaza-war-explained-mime-intl/index.html CNN]
* "Hamas terrorist attack" - [https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2023/10/08/investors-brace-jump-oil-prices-israel-declares-war-hamas/ The Telegraph]
* "terror attacks on Israel by Hamas" - [https://www.dw.com/en/latin-american-leaders-react-to-hamas-terror-attacks-on-israel/a-67069815 DW]
* "24 hours of terror", "terror on wings", "terrorists" - [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/13/israel-darkest-day-24-hours-of-terror-hamas-gaza The Guardian]
* "a terrorist organization", "terrorist attacks" - [[Yascha Mounk]] at [https://www.theglobeandmail.com/opinion/article-the-attacks-in-israel-raise-a-troubling-question-why-are-so-many/ The Globe and Mail] 
|title=RS quotes|bg=white|width=50em}}</li>
<li> "'''Major'''": the attack has been equated with the [[September 11 attacks]],[https://theintercept.com/2023/10/09/israel-hamas-september-11/][https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/2023/10/08/hamas-israel-intelligence-failure/][https://www.nytimes.com/2023/10/08/opinion/letters/israel-palestinian-hamas.html] and the sheer number of victims makes it the biggest such attack anywhere in the world since [[Camp Speicher massacre|2014]] or [[2015 Baga massacre|2015]].</li>
<li> "'''By violent non-state actors'''": sources are unanimous in stating that Hamas is: a violent, militant organization that has taken control of the Gaza Strip by force from the internationally recognized [[Palestinian Authority]].[https://www.cfr.org/backgrounder/what-hamas][https://www.theguardian.com/world/2023/oct/12/what-is-hamas-the-militant-group-that-rules-gaza][https://apnews.com/article/hamas-gaza-palestinian-authority-israel-war-ed7018dbaae09b81513daf3bda38109a][https://www.wsj.com/world/middle-east/hamas-militant-group-palestine-israel-attack-58738d3f][https://www.npr.org/2023/10/10/1204826544/hamas-israel-war-gaza-palestinian][https://www.reuters.com/world/middle-east/what-is-palestinian-group-hamas-2023-10-07/] Wikipedia itself [[Palestinian government#Split of Fatah and Hamas|states]] that "the Fatah-led government... has been recognized as the official government of the Palestinian Authority", and that Hamas merely exercises "''de facto'' control" over Gaza. No source that I've come across describes Hamas as a legitimate state actor.</li>
</ol>
: This establishes the attack as a "major terrorist incident conducted by violent non-state actors", satisfying the criteria for inclusion. [[User:François Robere|François Robere]] ([[User talk:François Robere|talk]]) 14:38, 13 October 2023 (UTC)}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1177186240|STYLE 1177186240}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1181797401|POL 1181797401}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1181797404|STYLE 1181797404}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we add "in Poland" to the start of this article?

Here is my proposal for adding the country in which this scandal is mainly focused:
{{td|The cash-for-visa scandal (Polish: afera wizowa, lit. 'visa affair') is an ongoing political scandal [...]|The cash-for-visa scandal (Polish: afera wizowa, lit. 'visa affair') is an ongoing political scandal in Poland [...]}}
Should we add this? <span style="text-shadow:1px 1px 10px #ff0000, 1px 1px 10px #ccc; font-weight:bold; font-family:Century Gothic;"><i>🔥[[User:Jalapeño|Jala]][[User_talk:Jalapeño|peño]]🔥</i></span> <small>[[Special:Contributions/Jalapeño|Stupid stuff I did]]</small> 14:51, 26 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Hanlon's razor#rfc_536AC25|Talk:Hanlon's razor]] expired 2023-10-26 03:01 ===
* Id: 536AC25
* User: Isaac Rabinovitch
* Date: 2023-10-25 17:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1181864680|SOC 1181864680}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1181934274|SOC 1181934274}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Starting over the previous discussion with (hopefully) more participants.

I'll restate the issue: currently the page begins this way:

{{Blockquote
|'''Hanlon's razor''' is an [[adage]] or [[rule of thumb]] that states:
: "Never attribute to [[Bad faith|malice]] that which is adequately explained by stupidity."
}}
This formulation of the adage is a direct quote from a book by Robert Bloch, not Robert Hanlon, though it's widely accepted that Bloch used the adage with Hanlon's permission. 

My problem with this is that it treats Bloch's book as the official version of an adage that had already been around for a while. It didn't even get called "Hanlon's Razor" until it appeared in the [[Jargon File]]. Now, it's a good way to formulate the adage, but we shouldn't treat it as ''the'' formulation. So I want to make a minor change:

{{Blockquote
|'''Hanlon's razor''' is an [[adage]] or [[rule of thumb]] that, in a typical formulation, states: "Never attribute to [[Bad faith|malice]] that which is adequately explained by stupidity."}}

As you can see from the previous section, a couple of other editors disagree. [[User:Isaac Rabinovitch|Isaac Rabinovitch]] ([[User talk:Isaac Rabinovitch|talk]]) 17:43, 25 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Purdue University Global#rfc_5DF13AC|Talk:Purdue University Global]] expired 2023-10-26 14:01 ===
* Id: 5DF13AC
* User: JA1776
* Date: 2023-09-26 13:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1177179520|ECON 1177179520}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|1181995609|ECON 1181995609}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What is the best way to describe how Purdue University Global's largest contractor, Graham Holdings Company, is paid?
# State in a paragraph about Graham Holdings that the company receives 12.5% of Purdue Global's operating revenue if certain financial benchmarks are met.
# State in the lede that Graham Holdings is "entitled" to 12.5% of Purdue Global's revenue.

The options can be compared at this diff: 
[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Purdue_University_Global&diff=1175241813&oldid=1175156450] [[User:JA1776|JA1776]] ([[User talk:JA1776|talk]]) 13:38, 26 September 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Christopher Columbus#rfc_06F3416|Talk:Christopher Columbus]] expired 2023-10-27 15:01 ===
* Id: 06F3416
* User: Mikola22
* Date: 2023-10-23 14:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1181518432|BIO 1181518432}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1182164703|BIO 1182164703}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We all know how Wikipedia works. In this case, historical figures must be presented in time context. As for Christopher Columbus, he did not live during the existence of Italy. One RS also talks about this. Given that mention of Italy is an anachronism, I suggest using information from several RS in which Christopher Columbus is presented as Genoese.
Sources that say Christopher Columbus was an Genoese explorer are:
*J.R. LeMaster, ‎Donald D. Kummings (2013) The Routledge Encyclopedia of Walt Whitman, p. 139.
*Jon Cowans (2003) Early Modern Spain: A Documentary History.  University of Pennsylvania Press. p. 28
*Médar Serrata (2022) The True and Only Bones of Columbus”: Relics, Archives, and Reversed Scenarios of Discovery. Cambridge University Press. p. 476
*Ernle Bradford (2014) Christopher Columbus. Open Road Media. p.139
*Paul Strathern (2023) The Other Renaissance: From Copernicus to Shakespeare: How the Renaissance in Northern Europe Transformed the World.
*Lawrence A. Clayton (2012) Bartolomé de las Casas: A Biography. p. 10.

Based on the above, I ask interested editors whether the introductory part should be harmonized with more RS and instead of information that ”Christopher Columbus was an Italian explorer” be changed to ”Christopher Columbus was an Genoese explorer”

{{Ping|Oshwah}} Is this Rfc still valid [[Talk:Christopher_Columbus/Archive_17#RFC:_on_qualifier_Italian_in_Christopher_Columbus_lead]] and can we officially end this issue here if it is not the same question(this Rfc)?

I would invite everyone from the previous Rfc to specifically state here whether or not you are in favor to change information from the introductory part: ”Christopher Columbus was an Italian explorer” to ”Christopher Columbus was an Genoese explorer”
{{Ping|Tarl N.|Warshy|Glendoremus|악준동 |CarolingianCitizen|Boynamedsue|Pincrete|Walrasiad|Eccekevin|Glendoremus|Ortizesp| Machinarium|Walrasiad|Machinarium|Fyunck(click)|TulsaPoliticsFan|Strebe|Boynamedsue|TulsaPoliticsFan|Fieari|Carlstak}} [[User:Mikola22|Mikola22]] ([[User talk:Mikola22|talk]]) 14:08, 23 October 2023 (UTC)}}

[[Wafa]] is the state media agency of the [[State of Palestine]]. It primarily covers two areas: (a) domestic Palestinian affairs and (b) the [[Israeli-Palestinian conflict]]. How should Wafa be treated on Wikipedia?

* '''Option 1''': It is generally reliable.
* '''Option 2a''': It is reliable for domestic Palestinian affairs but is not reliable for the Israeli-Palestinian conflict.
* '''Option 2b''': It is reliable for the Israeli-Palestinian conflict but is not reliable for domestic Palestinian affairs.
* '''Option 3''': It is generally unreliable.
* '''Option 4''': Deprecate.

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_3A0BD2C|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2023-10-30 19:01 ===
* Id: 3A0BD2C
* User: WeatherWriter

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Boxing#rfc_F1AAB95|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Boxing]] expired 2023-11-01 17:01 ===
* Id: F1AAB95
* User: Faren29
* Date: 2023-10-02 16:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1178275535|SOC 1178275535}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1182997614|SOC 1182997614}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I understand this change was caused by the adding of fights with no official announcements, however it is misleading and has lead to actual fight articles being poor in quality. For example, Spence vs Crawford was one of the most anticipated fights of this generation and the quality of the article was appalling. In some instances, some important fight articles, like Fulton vs Inoue, haven’t been made due to fight articles typically being accessed and created through the record table. Moreso, it is misleading because it leads people reading Wikipedia to believe that said fighter has no upcoming fight. BoxRec displays this well and it is one of the main authorities of boxing record-keeping. Therefore, I request a discussion to add back upcoming fights to record tables. As per, choices are to '''Support''' or '''Oppose'''. Cheers. [[User:Faren29|Faren29]] ([[User talk:Faren29|talk]]) 16:10, 2 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Battle of Kosovo#rfc_040F728|Talk:Battle of Kosovo]] expired 2023-11-02 01:01 ===
* Id: 040F728
* User: AzorzaI
* Date: 2023-11-01 13:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1182972678|HIST 1182972678}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1183073361|HIST 1183073361}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC relates to the removal/keeping of two nobles, Jonima and Muzaka, from the Commander/leaders section in the infobox. Earlier discussions has been mainly revolved around two views:

* One view suggests that Lazar arrived at the battle with his two allies, Vuk Brankovic, his son in law and Duke Vlatko Vuković, who served as the commander of King Tvrtko’s Bosnian army. Lazar commanded the centre; Vuk Brankovic was on the right and the left was under command of the Bosnian general Vlatko Vuković.

* The other view suggests that Jonima and Muzaka led their own troops, thereby holding an equivalent position as the other leaders of this battle.

[[User:AzorzaI|--Azor]] ([[User talk:AzorzaI|talk]]). 13:11, 1 November 2023 (UTC)}}
