Should school districts be required to meet [[WP:GNG]]? '''Support''' or '''oppose'''? [[User:Clovermoss|<span style="color:darkorchid">Clovermoss</span><span style="color:green">🍀</span>]] [[User talk:Clovermoss|(talk)]] 21:49, 22 October 2023 (UTC)}}


=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_32CE308|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2023-11-02 01:01 ===
* Id: 32CE308
* Date: 2023-10-03 01:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1178343066|POLICY 1178343066}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1183073365|POLICY 1183073365}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[WP:CONEXCEPT]] currently reads:
{{tqb|Certain policies and decisions made by the Wikimedia Foundation (WMF), its officers, and the [[Wikipedia:Arbitration Committee|Arbitration Committee]] of Wikipedia are outside the purview of editor consensus. This does not constitute an exhaustive list as much as a reminder that the decisions taken under this project apply only to the workings of the self-governing community of English Wikipedia.<br>{{bulletedlist|'''The WMF has legal control over, and liability for, Wikipedia. Decisions, rulings, and acts of the WMF Board and its duly appointed designees take precedence over, and preempt, consensus. A consensus among editors that any such decision, ruling, or act violates Wikimedia Foundation policies may be communicated to the WMF in writing.'''|[[Wikipedia:Office actions|Office actions]] are not permitted to be reversed by editors except by prior explicit office permission.|The English Wikipedia Arbitration Committee may issue binding decisions, within its [[Wikipedia:Arbitration/Policy#Scope and responsibilities|scope and responsibilities]], that override consensus. The committee has a noticeboard, [[Wikipedia:Arbitration/Requests/Clarification and Amendment]], for requests that such decisions be amended, and may amend such decisions at any time.|Some matters that may seem subject to the consensus of the community at the English-language Wikipedia (<samp>en.wikipedia.org</samp>) are in a separate domain. In particular, the community of [[MediaWiki]] software developers, including both paid Wikimedia Foundation staff and volunteers, and [[Wikipedia:Wikimedia sister projects|the sister wikis]], are largely separate entities. These independent, co-equal communities operate however they deem necessary or appropriate, such as adding, removing, or changing software features {{crossref|(see [[meta:Limits to configuration changes]])}}, or accepting or rejecting some contributions, even if their actions are not endorsed by editors here.}}|style=border-color:red;background-color:#FFCCCC}}

Should it be changed to:
{{tqb|Certain policies and decisions made by the Wikimedia Foundation (WMF), its officers, and the [[Wikipedia:Arbitration Committee|Arbitration Committee]] of Wikipedia are outside the purview of editor consensus. This does not constitute an exhaustive list as much as a reminder that the decisions taken under this project apply only to the workings of the self-governing community of English Wikipedia.<br>{{bulletedlist|'''The WMF has legal control over, and liability for, Wikipedia. Decisions, rulings, and acts of the WMF Board and its duly appointed designees that are needed to comply with legal obligations take precedence over, and preempt, consensus.'''|[[Wikipedia:Office actions|Office actions]] are not permitted to be reversed by editors except by prior explicit office permission.|The English Wikipedia Arbitration Committee may issue binding decisions, within its [[Wikipedia:Arbitration/Policy#Scope and responsibilities|scope and responsibilities]], that override consensus. The committee has a noticeboard, [[Wikipedia:Arbitration/Requests/Clarification and Amendment]], for requests that such decisions be amended, and may amend such decisions at any time.|Some matters that may seem subject to the consensus of the community at the English-language Wikipedia (<samp>en.wikipedia.org</samp>) are in a separate domain. In particular, the community of [[MediaWiki]] software developers, including both paid Wikimedia Foundation staff and volunteers, and [[Wikipedia:Wikimedia sister projects|the sister wikis]], are largely separate entities. These independent, co-equal communities operate however they deem necessary or appropriate, such as adding, removing, or changing software features {{crossref|(see [[meta:Limits to configuration changes]])}}, or accepting or rejecting some contributions, even if their actions are not endorsed by editors here.}}}}

The section that is proposed to be changed is highlighted in bold. 01:01, 3 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Village pump (WMF)#rfc_CD58844|Wikipedia talk:Village pump (WMF)]] expired 2023-11-02 01:01 ===
* Id: CD58844
* Date: 2023-10-03 01:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1178343070|PROP 1178343070}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|1183073368|PROP 1183073368}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
To address concerns held by the WMF at the incivility that is sometimes directed at its employees, should the following text, modeled on the [[Wikipedia_talk:Arbitration_Committee/Noticeboard|text at ARBCOM]], be added at the top of the [[WP:Village pump (WMF)|Village pump (WMF)]] and it's talk page?:
{{tqb|Behaviour on this page: This page is for engaging with and discussing the Wikimedia Foundation. Editors commenting here are required to act with appropriate decorum. While grievances, complaints, or criticism of the foundation are frequently posted here, you are expected to present them without being rude or hostile. Comments that are uncivil may be removed without warning. Personal attacks against other users, including employees of the Wikimedia Foundation, will be met with sanctions.}} 

01:01, 3 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Foreskin#rfc_5599AB5|Talk:Foreskin]] expired 2023-11-02 20:03 ===
* Id: 5599AB5
* User: Prcc27
* Date: 2023-10-03 19:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1178456928|SCI 1178456928}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1178456931|SOC 1178456931}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1183198773|SCI 1183198773}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1183198776|SOC 1183198776}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Does this paragraph belong in the '''function''' section of the article: “According to a policy statement from the World Health Organization, it is a ‘myth’ that foreskin removal with circumcision has any adverse effect on sexual pleasure. The view is echoed by other major medical organizations.”? 

Some users argue that it belongs in the function section, because circumcision and foreskin function are intertwined. Others argue that the sources referenced do not even reference foreskin function, and that perhaps this belongs in the circumcision subsection of our article or otherwise.

Please see the previous discussions on this issue to get a better understanding of the controversy: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Foreskin#Policy_statements][https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Foreskin#Comment_on_the_current_situation] [[User:Prcc27|Prcc27]] ([[User talk:Prcc27|talk]]) 19:26, 3 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Egypt#rfc_29CCC0D|Talk:Egypt]] expired 2023-11-02 21:01 ===
* Id: 29CCC0D
* User: Turnopoems
* Date: 2023-10-03 20:05:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1178466220|LANG 1178466220}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1178466225|STYLE 1178466225}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1183205853|LANG 1183205853}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1183205863|STYLE 1183205863}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A disagreement has arisen over [[Egyptian Arabic]] transliteration in the infobox of the [[Egypt]] article, with the discussion mainly taking place in the similarly named talk page entry. These are the two contradictory positions:

* One party states that it is merely a dialect and should therefore be omitted entirely in favor of the [[Standard Arabic]] transliteration only, regardless of phonetic differences.
* The other states that it is considered a language of its own from an academic point of view and should therefore be included as well due to its status as the national language of the country. 

The point of contention is mainly over the transliteration of the full name in the infobox, but has also spilled over to other parts of the article, such as the lead and Name sections. 

My suggestion to resolve the matter was to present credible academic sources that define the status of Egyptian Arabic, whether it's a language or a dialect, and proceed based on academic consensus. However, since the effort is largely one-sided I would prefer that other editors weigh in on the topic as well. [[User:Turnopoems|Turnopoems]] ([[User talk:Turnopoems|talk]]) 20:05, 3 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Battle of Kosovo#rfc_C9F0E1C|Talk:Battle of Kosovo]] expired 2023-11-02 22:01 ===
* Id: C9F0E1C
* User: Krisitor
* Date: 2023-11-01 16:49:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1183121944|HIST 1183121944}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1188804774|HIST 1188804774}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
:'''No''': Most reliable sources clearly state that the coalition was led by Lazar Hrebeljanović, Vuk Branković and Vlatko Vuković, that's all. Other allied contingents were indeed involved, some were mercenaries or troops from other neighbouring kingdoms and principalities, including Albanians and Hungarians, but there is no evidence that any Albanian or Hungarian lord headed his troops at the same level as the three Serbian princes. Muzaka and Jonima (if the latter was indeed present, which is not certain) were most likely led by Lazar, as stated in the French book ''L'Europe et l’Islam: Quinze siècles d’histoire'', from Laurens, Tolan and Veinstein (2009), page 134:
:''Le côté serbe était représenté par trois éléments au moins : le contingent du knez Lazar Hrebeljanović qui régnait alors sur la Serbie centrale et une partie du Kosovo oriental et dont '''l’armée incluait des éléments hongrois et albanais''' ; celui de Vuk Branković qui contrôlait la plus grande partie du Kosovo ; enfin, comme à Bileća, les troupes bosniaques de Tvertko étaient commandées par Vlatko Vuković.''
:This translates to :
:''The Serbian side was represented by at least three elements: the contingent of the knez Lazar Hrebeljanović, who ruled central Serbia and part of eastern Kosovo at the time, and whose '''army included Hungarian and Albanian elements'''; that of Vuk Branković, who controlled most of Kosovo; finally, like in Bileća, Tvertko's Bosnian troops were commanded by Vlatko Vuković.'' [[User:Krisitor|Krisitor]] ([[User talk:Krisitor|talk]]) 16:49, 1 November 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Drive (Incubus song)#rfc_53E6AA9|Talk:Drive (Incubus song)]] expired 2023-11-02 22:01 ===

{{rfcquote|text=
For the past year or so, there have been active discussions and [[WP:EDITWAR|edit wars]] regarding "Drive" by [[Incubus (band)|Incubus]] being [[nu metal]] or not. Some feel it should be included due to it being stated by ''Metal Hammer'' which is reliable, which also compares the song to other nu metal songs by other nu metal bands. However, some do not think this means it should be included due to other reasons. What are other opinions? Should it be included or not? '''Support inclusion'''<br>
'''Support removal'''

=== [[Talk:Atlanta#rfc_8576CA1|Talk:Atlanta]] expired 2023-11-04 21:01 ===
* Id: 8576CA1
* User: FISHERCAT5751
* Date: 2023-10-31 10:59:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1182785937|HIST 1182785937}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1182785939|LANG 1182785939}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1183523964|HIST 1183523964}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1183523967|LANG 1183523967}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 
I am submitting this RfC to discuss the inclusion of the Decolonial Atlas as a reliable source on relevant Wikipedia pages.

[https://decolonialatlas.wordpress.com/turtle-island-decolonized/ New research] has at long last brought accurate information about many Indigenous place names of North American cities to the public. Misinformation about these names is widespread, so the Decolonial Atlas spent 9 years consulting with hundreds of primary sources - tribal language programs and elders (all of whom are cited) - to accurately document place names for major cities and historical sites. These names are mostly unknown beyond Indigenous communities. Many are being shared publicly for the first time. 

Multiple Wikipedia editors have said that their edits to add this information to their respective Wikipedia pages keep getting rejected for citing a blog or free web host. The Decolonial Atlas is hosted on a free WordPress website. 

Self-published expert sources may be considered reliable when produced by an established subject-matter expert, whose work in the relevant field has previously been published by reliable, independent publications. 

The Decolonial Atlas has been engaged in this work for a decade. Its expertise has been recognized by the [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=591k56aMMGs BBC World News], Brown University, [https://umaine.edu/canam/publications/coming-home-map/coming-home-indigenous-place-names-canada-pdf-download/ the University of Maine], the New York Map Society, and more. The project is cited in 161 academic articles according to [https://scholar.google.com/scholar?hl=en&as_sdt=0%2C33&q=%22Decolonial+Atlas%22&btnG= Google Scholar].

[[User:FISHERCAT5751|FISHERCAT5751]] ([[User talk:FISHERCAT5751|talk]]) 10:59, 31 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:John Adams#rfc_BED77D1|Talk:John Adams]] expired 2023-11-06 04:01 ===

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Pakistani politics#rfc_CEBFC09|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Pakistani politics]] expired 2023-11-06 15:01 ===
* Id: CEBFC09
* User: امین اکبر#Naming conventions of constituencies: Arbitration request declined
* Date: 2023-10-07 14:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1179057144|POL 1179057144}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1179057147|STYLE 1179057147}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1183792891|POL 1183792891}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1183792895|STYLE 1183792895}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[2024 Pakistani general election|Elections]] are due to be held in [[Pakistan]] soon. New delimitations are underway after the [[2023 Pakistani census|2023 Census]] results announced and preliminary report on delimitations has been issued by [[Election Commission of Pakistan]] as of now[https://www.dawn.com/news/1778287]. There has been alot of [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Pakistani politics#Naming conventions of constituencies|controversy]] regarding naming conventions for electoral constituencies in Pakistan on Wikipedia. It has been taken to [[Special:Permalink/1149114123#Naming_conventions_of_constituencies|Arbitration forum]] as well where it was declined and was [[User talk:امین اکبر#Naming conventions of constituencies: Arbitration request declined|advised]] to use Dispute Resolution mechanism. However it still remains unresolved and it is going to make things further worse after the final delimitations report will be announced in case we do not come with a formal policy in this regard.

[[Constituencies of Pakistan|Pakistani constituencies']] titles in current form has many issues which can be deduced from previous [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Pakistani politics#Naming conventions of constituencies|discussions]] above but one thing is for sure that they are vague and confusing for readers. Let us look at an example,<br/>
[[PP-1 Attock-I]] is a constituency for [[Provincial Assembly of the Punjab|Punjab Assembly]].
I searched [https://www.google.com/search?client=ms-android-qmobile&sxsrf=APwXEdeZ3M8gotzIqIK0XS4fZ1mpmHdGBw:1683560656341&q=PP+1+election+result+2013&spell=1&sa=X&ved=2ahUKEwi51oOXiOb-AhWWNewKHcb9AQIQBSgAegQIBxAB&biw=400&bih=718&dpr=1.5 PP-1 election results 2013] on Google and it brought the snippet mentioning '''2013 Elections Shuja Khanzada of PML(N) won the seat by getting 38,971 votes''' transcluded from [[PP-1 Attock-I]] article while PP-1 in [[2013 Punjab provincial election|2013 elections]] was PP-1 Rawalpindi-I where '''Raja Ashfaq Hassan of PML-N won the seat by getting 50,982 votes'''[https://pakvoter.org/general-elections-2/pa-election-result-2013-punjab/]. Shuja Khanzada's constituency in 2013 was called PP-16 Attock-II. Even in [[PP-1 Attock-I#Election Results|history section]] of the PP-1 article it does not mention about the 2013 results of PP-1 Rawalpindi-I but it mentions the results of the PP-16 Attock-II(which is why Google is bringing wrong information) while PP-16 as of now is [[PP-16 Rawalpindi-X]]. It is a complete mess and what if after new delimitations it is again changed?

I brought the issue previously to the [[Talk:PP-1 Attock-I #Confusing search results|talkpage]] of the constituency article with no response from other editors. An [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Pakistani politics#RfC about Naming conventions of constituencies|RfC]] was also proposed previously but it was not properly framed and the process was buldgeoned with discussions without coming to a point. A proper community consensus is required to have an outcome and I think the best course of action in this regard is to have an RFC again with all the proposed and viable options for naming. It will be helpful to have a formal policy for naming of Electoral Constituencies in Pakistan.
[[User:Muneebll|Muneebll]] ([[User talk:Muneebll|talk]]) 14:58, 7 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:United States involvement in regime change in Latin America#rfc_33E8783|Talk:United States involvement in regime change in Latin America]] expired 2023-11-08 13:01 ===
* Id: 33E8783
* User: WMrapids
* Date: 2023-11-02 18:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1183190462|HIST 1183190462}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1183190468|POL 1183190468}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Television#rfc_92571E3|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Television]] expired 2023-11-10 19:01 ===
* Id: 92571E3
* User: MapReader
* Date: 2023-10-11 18:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1179682962|STYLE 1179682962}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1180143207|MEDIA 1180143207}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1180143213|PROJ 1180143213}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1184489221|MEDIA 1184489221}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|1184489222|STYLE 1184489222}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/WikiProjects_and_collaborations|prev|1184489224|PROJ 1184489224}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
MOSTV is silent on what number format is appropriate for references to season/series and episodes within TV articles.  There are both numerical (“season 1”) and worded (“season one”) formats used within the text of the project MoS itself, and actual practice within TV articles varies widely.

WP-wide policy (MOS:NUMERAL) is that within tables and infoboxes, digits are used, but in article text including headings, numbers smaller than ten should be written as words, and proximate related numbers should follow the same format.  Otherwise, numbers ten and up are written as numerals.

I suggest that it would be helpful to add a sentence to this MoS, within the “Parent, season, and episode article structure” section, to clarify how season and episode numbers should best be formatted within TV articles.  I suggest that a choice needs to be made between the following options, before establishing consensus on the wording of such an addition:

'''Option One''': Follow MOSNUM.  Season and episode numbers in article tables and infoboxes should be in numerals, and in headings and body, should be in words if below ten, with consistent format being used for larger numbers in the same context (i.e. if seasons one through nine are in words then seasons ten up are also in words).

'''Option Two''': Follow MOSNUM except for headings and subheadings.  Thus season and episode numbers should be in numerals in tables, infoboxes and headings/sub-headings, but in words (below ten, and above in the same context) within article body.

'''Option Three''': Season and episode numbers should be expressed as numerals, in tables, infoboxes, headings and article body.

I seek editors’ views on the best approach before proposing a specific addition to the MoS. If I might finish with a personal view, I would ask that if there is support for option three, a justification for TV project articles departing so significantly from WP-wide policy does need to be advanced. [[User:MapReader|MapReader]] ([[User talk:MapReader|talk]]) 18:07, 11 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_451BFD0|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2023-11-10 21:01 ===
* Id: 451BFD0
* User: Boud
* Date: 2023-11-10 16:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1184473730|POLICY 1184473730}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1184473731|TECH 1184473731}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1184506100|POLICY 1184506100}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|1184506105|TECH 1184506105}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[[Module:Find sources/templates/Find sources]] currently contains [[WP:ADVOCACY]] for Google/Alphabet Inc, one of the world's most powerful and monopolistic, [[Criticism of Google|highly criticised corporations]] that [https://archive.today/2023.10.29-014426/https://www.theverge.com/2023/10/26/23933206/google-apple-search-deal-safari-18-billion pays 10s] of [https://archive.today/2023.11.08-200354/https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2023/11/08/google-search-default-iphone-samsung billions of dollars] to try to maintain a monopoly with its [[Criticism of Google#Criticism of search engine|criticised search engine]]. This advocacy is contrary to our mission. Moreover, this advocacy violates the spirit of the [[:foundation:Policy:Universal_Code_of_Conduct#3.1_–_Harassment|Universal Code of Conduct]] in the sense that it encourages Wikipedians to [[surveillance capitalism|disclose their personal data]], and in some cases puts us [[List of people imprisoned for editing Wikipedia|at risk of harm]]. What editorial changes should we make in the module to reduce the level of advocacy, without favouring one particular attempted monopoly and without harming Wikipedians' privacy rights, while helping readers find reliable, independent sources using [[WP:NOTABILITY|notable]] search engines? [[User:Boud|Boud]] ([[User talk:Boud|talk]]) 16:44, 10 November 2023 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the page contain the following ''see also'' section?

*[[Murders of Kate Bushell and Lyn Bryant]] – unsolved similar, and contemporary, high-profile random murders of a child and a mother out walking with their dogs in 1997 and 1998 respectively. Bryant was murdered three days before Stone was first convicted of the Russell killings
*[[Colin Norris]] – subject of a similarly high-profile and current miscarriage of justice campaign
*[[Simon Hall (murderer)|Simon Hall]] – UK murderer who maintained his innocence for years after his conviction and was helped by miscarriage of justice campaigners, only to go on to confess
*[[Ernest Barrie]] – UK killer whose conviction was quashed after a ''[[Rough Justice (UK TV programme)|Rough Justice]]'' campaign, only for him to go on to kill a man
*[[Michael Weir (murderer)|Michael Weir]] – UK murderer who had his murder conviction quashed only to be found guilty again several years later

=== [[Talk:Hamas#rfc_D73BA6B|Talk:Hamas]] expired 2023-11-12 05:01 ===

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1184716674|HIST 1184716674}}

=== [[Talk:Hamas#rfc_EC00AF4|Talk:Hamas]] expired 2023-11-12 05:01 ===
* Id: EC00AF4
* User: KlayCax
* Date: 2023-10-13 04:54:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1179900202|HIST 1179900202}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1179900204|POL 1179900204}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1179900206|RELI 1179900206}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1179900207|SOC 1179900207}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1184716674|HIST 1184716674}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1184716676|POL 1184716676}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1184716678|RELI 1184716678}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1184716681|SOC 1184716681}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Editors have recently gone back and forth in describing the ideology of Hamas in the lead. This is likely due to the fact that academic sources, popular media, and statements on/from Hamas have widely varied over the decades. Early Hamas statements explicitly called for the destruction of (at least the current conception) Israel. While statements past-2017 have been more ambiguous. While [https://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2023/10/hamas-covenant-israel-attack-war-genocide/675602/ some academic sources take them on their word, others express doubts on whether the 2017 statement actually changed anything].

* '''Option #1:''' Hamas is predominately described as supporting the end of Israel within the article. Statements post-2017 are treated with significant skepticism.
* '''Option #2:''' Both the 1988 and 2017 statements are left outside of the lead; lead doesn't state either. The article gives relatively equal weight to those who believe there has been a changed in the goals of Hamas and those who do not. 
* '''Option #3:''' Hamas is predominately described as accepting the 1967 Israeli-Palestinian borders, post 2017. Early viewpoints are significantly trimmed from the article.
* '''Option #4:''' Another option not listed.

I'm personally in favor of #2. What do people here believe is the best solution in resolving this?

: '''#2. (Note: Creator of RFC)''' Since there hasn't been a clear consensus in the academic literature, news media sources, among other things, we shouldn't definitely state one or the other. [[User:KlayCax|KlayCax]] ([[User talk:KlayCax|talk]]) 04:54, 13 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Abhishek Malhan#rfc_AE065CD|Talk:Abhishek Malhan]] expired 2023-11-12 17:01 ===
* Id: AE065CD
* User: Leoneix
* Date: 2023-11-08 04:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1184780959|BIO 1184780959}}
* RFC Text:

{{WikiProject banner shell |living=yes |1=
{{WikiProject Biography |class=C |listas=Malhan, Abhishek |living=yes}}
{{WikiProject India |class=C |importance=Low}}
{{WikiProject YouTube |class=C |importance=Low}}
}}

''' Issues '''

Hi @[[User:Columbidae5|Columbidae5]], this article doesn't seem to have a NPOV and is slanted towards recent events due to the following reasons-
* primarily focuses on Malhan's accomplishments and positive qualities, highlighting his participation in popular reality shows and drawing inspiration from established YouTubers.
* usage of positive language to describe Abhishek Malhan, using words like "known" and "emerged".
* allegations are mentioned at the end of the article, after establishing a positive image, this minimizes the impact of these claims
* the article does not provide much context about Malhan's early career or his work on YouTube before he participated in Bigg Boss OTT and Temptation Island India.
* using words like "fandom war" presents the conflict in a way that is relevant to social media.
[[User:Leoneix|Leoneix]] <sub>([[User talk:Leoneix|talk]])</sub> 04:14, 8 November 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of Islamist terrorist attacks#rfc_13795B9|Talk:List of Islamist terrorist attacks]] expired 2023-11-14 08:01 ===
* Id: 13795B9
* User: TarnishedPath
* Date: 2023-11-07 00:15:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1183873862|POL 1183873862}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1183873866|RELI 1183873866}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1188685584|POL 1188685584}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1188685586|RELI 1188685586}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the [[WP:LISTCRITERIA]] for [[List of Islamist terrorist attacks]] be:
# The consensus of [[WP:RS|reliable sources]] describe the incident as "terrorism" in article voice
# The same [[WP:RS|reliable sources]] make it clear that there were Islamist motivations as per dictionary definitions of the word Islamist
# The incident is [[WP:N|Notable]] and
# The incident has a corresponding [[WP:Article|stand-alone Wikipedia article]]
For reference:
<br/>
[https://www.google.com/search?q=islamist+meaning&sca_esv=579969189&rlz=1C1SQJL_enAU1053AU1053&sxsrf=AM9HkKlQMoST6xZfCDJykMaJQeyK8edpEg%3A1699316355583&ei=g4JJZfWQI5bZseMPrrO2uAQ&oq=Islamist&gs_lp=Egxnd3Mtd2l6LXNlcnAiCElzbGFtaXN0KgIIADIPECMYigUYsAMYJxhGGPkBMhMQABiABBgUGIcCGLEDGIMBGLADMggQABiABBiwAzIIEAAYgAQYsAMyCBAAGIAEGLADMggQABiABBiwAzIJEAAYBxgeGLADMgkQABgHGB4YsAMyCRAAGAcYHhiwAzIIEAAYgAQYsAMyJBAAGIoFGLADGEYY-QEYlwUYjAUY3QQYRhj0Axj1Axj2A9gBAUibEVAAWABwAXgAkAEAmAEAoAEAqgEAuAEByAEAwgIkEAAYigUYsAMYRhj5ARiXBRiMBRjdBBhGGPQDGPUDGPYD2AEB4gMEGAEgQYgGAZAGC7oGBggBEAEYEw&sclient=gws-wiz-serp Google defines Islamist as]: 

*an advocate or supporter of Islamic fundamentalism; a person who advocates increasing the influence of Islamic law in politics and society. (noun)
*relating to, advocating, or supporting Islamic fundamentalism. (adjective)

[https://www.dictionary.com/browse/Islamist Dictionary.com defines Islamist as]:
*a supporter or advocate of Islamic fundamentalism. (noun)
*supporting or advocating Islamic fundamentalism. (adjective) 
[[User:TarnishedPath|''TarnishedPath'']]<sup>[[User talk:TarnishedPath|talk]]</sup> 00:15, 7 November 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sommer Ray#rfc_171890B|Talk:Sommer Ray]] expired 2023-11-16 03:01 ===
* Id: 171890B
* User: InvadingInvader
* Date: 2023-10-17 02:24:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1180513687|BIO 1180513687}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1185342283|BIO 1185342283}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Does the inclusion of the following sets content in the article violate WP:PROMO and other content policies?
{{Collapse|Ray formerly had a three-month long relationship with rapper [[Machine Gun Kelly (musician)|Machine Gun Kelly]] prior to his engagement with actress [[Megan Fox]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Ushe |first=Naledi |date=2021-03-25 |title=Model Sommer Ray Accuses Machine Gun Kelly of 'Cheating' on Her with Megan Fox Before They Broke Up |url=https://people.com/style/sommer-ray-accuses-machine-gun-kelly-cheating-on-her-with-megan-fox/ |access-date=2023-09-28 |website=Peoplemag |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Bonner |first=Mehra |date=2021-03-26 |title=Machine Gun Kelly’s Ex Sommer Ray Just Accused Him of Cheating With Megan Fox |url=https://www.cosmopolitan.com/entertainment/celebs/a35947329/machine-gun-kelly-sommer-ray-cheating-megan-fox/ |access-date=2023-09-28 |website=Cosmopolitan |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Soloski |first=Alexis |date=2020-07-03 |title=Don’t Call Him Machine Gun Kelly |language=en-US |work=The New York Times |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2020/07/03/style/machine-gun-kelly-colson-baker-megan-fox.html |access-date=2023-09-28 |issn=0362-4331}}</ref>{{Reflist talk}}|Set A: Information on Ray's relationship with Machine Gun Kelly}}{{Collapse|Sommer additionally founded Imaraïs in 2017 alongside attorney Felicia Hershenhorn and Nutrabolics cofounder Aaron Hester, a line of [[Veganism|vegan]] health [[Gummy candy|gummies]] which contain chemicals that enhance skin appearance.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://wwd.com/feature/sommer-ray-imarais-ingestibles-1234834844/|title=EXCLUSIVE: Influencer Sommer Ray Fronts Ingestible Beauty Line|first=Alexa|last=Tietjen|date=June 4, 2021|publisher=[[Women's Wear Daily]]}}</ref> The ingestibles partnered with four North American retailers distribute Ray's product.<ref>{{Cite web |last=McCormack |first=Claire |date=2022-02-25 |title=Influencer Sommer Ray's Imaraïs Beauty Enters J.C. Penney As The First Ingestible Brand In Its New Beauty Assortment |url=https://www.beautyindependent.com/influencer-sommer-rays-imarais-beauty-enters-j-c-penney-first-ingestible/ |access-date=2023-09-27 |website=Beauty Independent |language=en-US}}</ref> Later, Ray launched a mobile app, Evolve fitness, which she debuted on May 3, 2018.<ref name=":5">{{Cite web |last=LaCroix |first=Emy |date=2018-05-05 |title=Sommer Ray Dishes About Her Fitness App, Insecurity, and Childhood! |url=https://www.lifeandstylemag.com/posts/sommer-ray-fitness-app-159439/ |access-date=2023-08-10 |website=Life & Style |language=en-US}}</ref> Her endeavors also led to the creation of a line of [[subscription box]]es, titled "Sommethings", which she curates.<ref name="seventeen.com">{{Cite web |last=Pellot |first=Emerald |date=2021-03-25 |title=Who is Sommer Ray? === [[Talk:Lango people#rfc_AA985A6|Talk:Lango people]] expired 2023-11-19 02:01 ===
* Id: AA985A6
* User: Ngunalik
* Date: 2023-11-19 00:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1185790192|UNSORTED 1185790192}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|1185797604|UNSORTED 1185797604}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hi Everyone

In summary researchers placed groups as Nilotic when they meant geographical location rather than ethnic i.e. people who settled along river Nile. However, in contrast to geographical, the term Nilo-Hamitic referred to ethnic groups of Ateker peoples such as Koramojong, Teso, Lango, Kumam, Turkana etc. Then Nilo-Semitic aka Shemitic are ethnic grouping of Lwo peoples e.g. Acoli, Alur, Jo Padola, Lwo/Luo of Sudan, Lwo/Luo of Kenya, Tanzania, Congo etc and some other groups that I am yet to study, I am not very well versed with this part. 

Two groups of the Ateker peoples i.e. Langi and Kumam who although currently use borrowed Lwo/Luo words and speak a mixture of their Ateker languages and Lwo/Luo, they are not Lwo and their languages cannot be classed as Lwo/Luo either. This is the view of by some editors who are trying to correct what was wrongly placed in Ethnolgue or other sources. The editors noticed that there has been erros in placing the Langi and Kumam groups under Luo/Lwo, they are not Lwo/Luo nor is their language classification.

Please google http://www.hartford-hwp.com/archives/35/013.html 
Scores of articles are listed there.

In addition there are some articles such as 

https://web.archive.org/web/20201210010927id_/https://eprints.soas.ac.uk/29330/1/10731425.pdf 

From page 50 onwards show that Lango, Kumam, Teso etc are grouped under Paranilotes, Plain Nilotes aka Nilo-Hamites, the anthropologists noticed that Lango and Kumam had language shift in the 18th centuary and borrowed Lwo/Luo words as well as cultures but that Kumam or Lango clans are not Lwo/Luo up todate. They are known as Nilo-Hamites of Ateker peoples together with Teso, Karmojong etc.

The Wikipedia article is currently showing the first paragraph of Lango article stating the opposite from the second pargraph if you see it under Early History section. We need to first start a review from this article if possible. 

Two citations have been placed in Lango article and one of them appears in Ateker peoples article already. They mention the points which contradic the contents of the first paragraph (please see below). 

Uzoigwe, G. N. The beginnings of Lango society : a review of evidence. OCLC 38562622.

Webster, James Bertin (1973). The Iteso during the asonya. East African Pub. House. pp. xxi.

Therefore, please see what you can do to improve these articles. 
If we can suggest the changes that should be made here in the Talk page first then an editor can transfer that to the relevant pages that would help. Thanks a lot
<!-- [[User:DoNotArchiveUntil]] 01:01, 24 December 2023 (UTC) -->{{User:ClueBot III/DoNotArchiveUntil|1703379688}}
[[User:Ngunalik|Ngunalik]] ([[User talk:Ngunalik|talk]]) 00:34, 19 November 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Mike Johnson (Louisiana politician)#rfc_B82F946|Talk:Mike Johnson (Louisiana politician)]] expired 2023-11-19 11:01 ===
* Id: B82F946
* User: KlayCax
* Date: 2023-10-28 06:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1182270053|BIO 1182270053}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1182270056|HIST 1182270056}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1182270059|POL 1182270059}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1182270060|RELI 1182270060}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1182270062|SOC 1182270062}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1185851564|BIO 1185851564}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1185851566|HIST 1185851566}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1185851571|POL 1185851571}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|1185851575|RELI 1185851575}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1185851577|SOC 1185851577}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
International and domestic news agencies [https://www.theglobeandmail.com/world/us-politics/article-new-us-house-speaker-mike-johnson/ have frequently made mention of] Speaker Johnson's [https://www.nbcnews.com/nbc-out/out-politics-and-policy/mike-johnson-house-speaker-lgbtq-views-scrutiny-rcna122317 "prominent" attempts to criminalize consensual homosexual relationships] while working at the Alliance Defending Freedom.  During this time, he repeatedly wrote that homosexuals should be jailed if they engaged in consensual same-sex physical relations, supported sodomy laws, and composed arguably the most notable ''[[Amicus curiae|amicus brief]]'' to the U.S. Supreme Court ruling in [[Lawrence v. Texas]] (2003) defending their constitutionality.

Several editors have suggested that wording similar to this should be introduced into the the lead:

<blockquote>While working at the [[Alliance Defending Freedom]], he advocated for [[Sodomy laws in the United States|the criminalization of gay sex]] and wrote a prominent [[Amicus curiae|''amicus'' brief]] opposing the eventual [[Supreme Court of the United States|U.S. Supreme Court]] ruling in ''[[Lawrence v. Texas]]'' (2003).</blockquote>

Other editors have suggested that his involvement in [[covenant marriage]] laws, founding of ''Freedom Guard'', and other pieces of information is far more notable, and that the sentence is a [[WP: NPOV]] issue that immediately bias readers against Johnson.

Is this piece of information neutral ''and'' notable enough to include in the lead? [[User:KlayCax|KlayCax]] ([[User talk:KlayCax|talk]]) 06:40, 28 October 2023 (UTC)}}

Known for her beauty content,<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://theexposure.co/melbourne-influencers/|title=Melbourne Influencers|website=The Exposure Co.|accessdate=5 October 2023}}</ref> her YouTube channel gained over 500 thousand subscribers. I think it ''should'' be on the page as it is all public information and includes a citation from ''The Herald Sun'' that bolsters the subject's notability. I feel like if I put it back up, it will just be taken down again. I don't quite know how to approach while avoiding getting into an edit war and because the user in question is unregistered. Thoughts? – [[User:Starklinson|Starklinson]] 09:35, 19 November 2023 (UTC)}}

Hi Everyone

In summary researchers placed groups as Nilotic when they meant geographical location rather than ethnic i.e. people who settled along river Nile. This is the view of by some editors who are trying to correct what was wrongly placed in Ethnolgue or other sources. The editors noticed that there has been erros in placing the Langi and Kumam groups under Luo/Lwo, they are not Lwo/Luo nor is their language classification.

Please google http://www.hartford-hwp.com/archives/35/013.html 
Scores of articles are listed there.

In addition there are some articles such as 

https://web.archive.org/web/20201210010927id_/https://eprints.soas.ac.uk/29330/1/10731425.pdf 

From page 50 onwards show that Lango, Kumam, Teso etc are grouped under Paranilotes, Plain Nilotes aka Nilo-Hamites, the anthropologists noticed that Lango and Kumam had language shift in the 18th centuary and borrowed Lwo/Luo words as well as cultures but that Kumam or Lango clans are not Lwo/Luo up todate. They are known as Nilo-Hamites of Ateker peoples together with Teso, Karmojong etc.

Uzoigwe, G. N. The beginnings of Lango society : a review of evidence. OCLC 38562622.

Webster, James Bertin (1973). The Iteso during the asonya. East African Pub. House. pp. xxi.

Therefore, please see what you can do to improve these articles.

=== [[Talk:Ahaaha Rocks#rfc_F35E147|Talk:Ahaaha Rocks]] expired 2023-11-20 20:01 ===
* Id: F35E147
* Date: 2023-10-21 19:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1181241573|HIST 1181241573}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1181241578|LANG 1181241578}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1186077668|HIST 1186077668}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1186077672|LANG 1186077672}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the article contain the following Etymology section?
{{blockquote|"Ahaaha" Is a word used for the canoe that the dead [[Mahavira|Araha]] were transported to in the sky. It has been translated as "lifted up lofty" or "the sky."{{sfn|Fox|1925|page=[https://books.google.com/books?id=blOgAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA237 237]}} Or it may mean breeze or a species of fish. In the Hawaiian language, “For example, “Ka makani ka¯ ‘aha‘aha la‘i o Niua’ alludes to ‘the peaceful ‘aha‘aha breeze of Niua that drives in the ‘aha‘aha ﬁsh.’ In this example, ‘aha‘aha refers to both the ﬁsh and breeze of the same name. Fishermen knew that when this breeze blew, it was the right time to launch their canoes in search of the ‘aha‘aha ﬁsh.”<ref>Kapä Oliveira, “Ke Alanui Kı¯ke’Eke’E O Maui: Na Wai Ho’I Ka ‘Ole O Ke Akamai, He Alanui I Ma’a I Ka Hele ‘Ia E O’U Mau Ma¯kua” (PhD diss., [[University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa]], 2006) Kapa Oliveira, “Ke Alanui Kı¯ke’Eke’E O Maui.” pp. 273-274</ref>{{sfn|Louis|2011|page=[https://books.google.com/books?hl=en&lr=&id=qcJxAAAAQBAJ&oi=fnd&pg=PA167 167]}}{{efn-ua|‘Ahaaha’ mimics the sound of a wave crashing on the rocks. This [[onomatopoeia|onomatopoetic]] device illustrate how natives experienced and interacted with natural phenomena; and learned from and assimilated them into their culture and actions.{{sfn|Louis|2011|pages=[https://books.google.com/books?id=qcJxAAAAQBAJ&pg=PA170 169-171]}}}}  In the [[Maori language]] "ahaaha" means "Alarm, shyness, want of confidence."{{sfn|Williams|Williams|Polynesian Society (N.Z.)|1917|page=[https://www.google.com/books/edition/A_Dictionary_of_the_Maori_Language/p84vAQAAMAAJ?hl=en&gbpv=1&dq=ahaaha&pg=PA3&printsec=frontcover 3]}} In the [[Tahitian language]] it means: "the name of a fish remarkable for its rapidity in swimming; rapidity, swiftness; a swift pursuer; to pursue, as a warrior his enemy; neat, smart, of genteel carriage; cadaverous, as a dead animal."{{sfn|Davies|1851|page=[https://archive.org/details/tahitianenglishd00davirich/page/8/mode/2up?q=ahaaha 8]}}  The [[Hawaiian Language]] defines it twice: "sitting squarely; uprightly" and "to pant; to breath hard on account of heat, as a hog or a dog."<ref>{{Cite book |last=Lorrin |first=Andrews |title=A Dictionary of the Hawaiian Language |last2=Parker |first2=Henry Hodges |year=1922 |pages=28}}</ref>}}
–[[User:Dlthewave|dlthewave]] [[User_talk:Dlthewave|☎]] 19:28, 21 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_602DB41|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2023-11-21 22:01 ===
* Id: 602DB41
* User: Szmenderowiecki
* Date: 2023-10-26 16:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1182019417|POLICY 1182019417}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1186811055|POLICY 1186811055}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There were two discussions on the topic of an RfC review noticeboard separate from AN. A [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Administrators%27_noticeboard/Archive287#RfC_close_review_please? 2017 discussion] briefly touched on the topic, and under a recent close review, there was 
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Administrators%27_noticeboard/Archive355#The_futility_of_%22close_review%22 another one], which was relatively extensive.
It appears that there was [[WP:RFCBEFORE|enough brainstorming]] to have at least a discussion to create a new board.

'''It is proposed to:'''

*Create a separate "Close review" page (CLRV/RFCRV) to handle challenges to closures.
*Create an archive of all close reviews in one place (something like [[Wikipedia:Administrators%27_noticeboard/Closure_review_archive|this]] but updated and not self-reported)
*Generally model the CLRV on [[WP:DRV|deletion review]] processes, but with a few quirks. To be exact:
*#The duty of the user to discuss the closure with the closer will stay, [[WP:NACIP|except for closures made by IP editors]], which may be reverted without discussion.
*#When pushing a "Request a close review" button, there will be an automatically generated template (something like when opening an AE request) where the user will put the necessary data (link to the RfC, diff(s) of closure, user who closed an RfC, evidence of talking with the user, evidence of notifying them about the review, reason for making the request, possibly other fields should there be a need)
*#Create "Involved", "Uninvolved" and "Discussion" sections for discussing the merits of the closure (see [[WP:INVOLVED]] for details). Admins may sanction users who routinely post their opinions in the "Uninvolved" part of the closure if they are involved.
*#:Editors will !vote "Endorse" or "Overturn". Overturned discussions will be automatically reopened until the next closer comes. Overturned closures should be collapsed and the CLRV thread provided in the hat above the RfC for reference.
*#:CLRV should not be RfC round 2. Only closer's judgment should be analysed. Statements that rehash the arguments in the RfC or do not discuss the soundness of the closure given the arguments presented in the RfC should be discarded from consideration. (Cf. Deletion review should not be used, in [[WP:DRV]])
*#:Editors will determine the burden of demonstrating the (un)soundness of the closure if the page is created. This may potentially impact [[WP:NOCON]].
*Modify [[WP:CLOSECHALLENGE]], [[Wikipedia:Processes#Formal_review]] and other relevant policies, guidelines and information/explanatory pages to direct closure review requests to the newly created page. Edit all relevant templates and post relevant info to AN/ANI so that editors engage in close reviews on the dedicated forum.

I would like to see if there is consensus for a concept of the page, before actually starting to create it.

[[User:Szmenderowiecki|Szmenderowiecki]] ([[User talk:Szmenderowiecki|talk]]) 16:10, 26 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Flight of Nagorno-Karabakh Armenians#rfc_2979433|Talk:Flight of Nagorno-Karabakh Armenians]] expired 2023-11-23 20:01 ===
* Id: 2979433
* User: Grandmaster
* Date: 2023-10-24 19:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1181717721|HIST 1181717721}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1181717726|POL 1181717726}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1186527586|HIST 1186527586}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1186527590|POL 1186527590}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
A UN mission to Nagorno-Karabakh reported that "they did not come across any reports — either from the local population or from others — of violence against civilians following the latest ceasefire." [https://press.un.org/en/2023/db231002.doc.htm]

Which of the following is the best way to deal with this information:

*'''Option 1''' - Mention this statement in the body and the [[WP:LEAD|lead]] of the article with proper attribution.
*'''Option 2''' - Mention this statement in the body of the article with proper attribution.
*'''Option 3''' - Make no mention at all.

Please enter Option 1,  Option 2 or Option 3, followed by a brief statement, in the Survey. Do not reply to other users in the Survey. Back-and-forth discussion may be conducted in the Threaded Discussion section. [[User:Grandmaster|<span style="font-family:Arial;color:#464646">'''''Grand'''''</span>]][[User talk:Grandmaster|<span style="font-family:Arial;color:#808080">'''''master'''''</span>]] 19:07, 24 October 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_E09EFB1|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2023-11-24 22:01 ===
* Id: E09EFB1
* User: Wikiexplorationandhelping
* Date: 2023-11-24 20:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1186683309|POLICY 1186683309}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1186691004|POLICY 1186691004}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hey guys, I feel like this is an issue that is important to address. According to [[WP:Admin count]], which other users and I have contributed to - since 2011, we have been having a net loss of administrators. There has been a long, gradual decline since then, with a sudden decrease in early 2023 due to new policies. I don't know how well this project can be managed with less admins around to do ever more tasks. I feel like something should change, but I do not know what should. What does the community say? Cheers, [[User:Wikiexplorationandhelping|Wikiexplorationandhelping]] ([[User talk:Wikiexplorationandhelping|talk]]) 20:48, 24 November 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Mike Johnson (Louisiana politician)#rfc_9919A04|Talk:Mike Johnson (Louisiana politician)]] expired 2023-11-25 02:01 ===

There is a present disagreement among editors on whether Mike Johnson's affiliation to the Christian right should be mentioned within the lead.

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Royalty and Nobility#rfc_8510C83|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Royalty and Nobility]] expired 2023-11-25 20:01 ===
* Id: 8510C83
* User: AndrewPeterT

* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1186546849|BIO 1186546849}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1186834992|BIO 1186834992}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1186834997|HIST 1186834997}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia_talk:Naming_conventions_(royalty_and_nobility)&diff=prev&oldid=1183125147 A previous RfC] determined that there was consensus to support updating [[WP:NCROY]], a guideline that has been a basis for titling articles on European monarchs since the fall of the [[Western Roman Empire]], to explicitly allow the use of shorter titles for these sovereigns if disambiguation is unnecessary. Given this result, which of the following four options is the best way to (re)title Wikipedia articles on pertinent European sovereigns going forward?
#'''Option 1''' - Maintain the status quo and issue a [[WP:MORATORIUM]] on all [[WP:Requested moves|requested moves]] (RMs) for European monarchs’ articles under the scope of WP:NCROY until 365 days have passed since the closure date of this RfC
#'''Option 2''' - Rename pertinent article titles to follow [[WP:NCROY]] as currently written ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:Naming_conventions_(royalty_and_nobility)&diff=prev&oldid=1183348878 whose guidance] deferred to [[WP:COMMONNAME]] at the time of this RfC’s opening)
#'''Option 3''' - Rename pertinent article titles to follow [[WP:RELIABLE]] and amend WP:NCROY accordingly
#'''Option 4''' - Rename pertinent article titles to follow [[WP:CONSISTENT]] and amend WP:NCROY accordingly
'''All participants are strongly encouraged to read the nominator’s extended rationale before contributing.''' '''''[[User:AndrewPeterT|Hurricane]] [[User talk:AndrewPeterT|Andrew]] ([[Special:Contributions/AndrewPeterT|444]])''''' 22:01, 23 November 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Tuple#rfc_FEAF7FA|Talk:Tuple]] expired 2023-11-26 18:01 ===
* Id: FEAF7FA
* User: Rbrane7
* Date: 2023-11-25 20:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1186842199|SCI 1186842199}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1186978070|SCI 1186978070}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 
I would like to ask comments with argumentation for or against infinite [[tuple]]  concept, by which I call a presence of Infinite Tuple on [[Tuple]] page.

The problem was discussed between a couple of mathematicians with no argumentation against the concept other than missing external citations. I think there should rather be discussion about arguments in general instead of just resources. The argumentation for the concept is based on axioms of [[Set theory]] namely [[ZFC]] and mainly [[Axiom of choice]].

The opponents of the concept already attempted to ban me and separate me from editing of English Wiki. I was unbanned then, but I don't see reasonable to follow aggressive bilateral disputation with undoing actions of each other. So, I'm asking third party experts form participation in dispute.

My opinion is, that infinite tuple is inherently here, regardless how we call it. Therefore, we should not try to find different term, but rather we should note it on the [[tuple]] page. Argumentation for can be most simply based on [[Axiom of choice]] of [[ZFC]], which effectively defines  infinite [[Cartesian product]], which is quoted on its wiki page. If we have infinite [[Cartesian product]], which is apparently true, then I believe, we should have defined also infinite [[Tuple]]. We define the [[tuple]] most simply as function of [[natural number]] (as [[set (mathematics)]]). Infinite [[tuple]] is then simply function of [[ordinal number]] (as [[set (mathematics)]]).

So, please, give me independent opinion to my conclusions and relevancy of noting infinite [[Tuple]] on [[tuple]] page.

I already asked my colleague from studies on [[Faculty of Mathematics and Physics, Charles University]] for an opinion. He said, that he intuitively understood [[Tuple]] as finite but the presence of infinite [[Tuple]] on tuple page counts logical and needed.

It is so tiny problem, or no problem at all, that I'm surprised, that it triggered so much animosity. It should have been solved on [[talk]] page of the topic and it was attempted by my side. However, no compromise was reached there. [[User:Rbrane7|Rbrane7]] ([[User talk:Rbrane7|talk]]) 20:21, 25 November 2023 (UTC)}}

Every reliable source on Earth, including those cited here, states that Trump's claims that the election was stolen were a brazen lie, without even a shred of truth to them: pure and utter fabrication. And yet the cowardly, weak-willed editors of this project refuse to allow an encylopedia to speak the well-documented, all-too-well-known truth. Grow a spine, you cowardly jellyfish. {{rfcquote|text=
Should the lead of the article mention that some of the political violence has been considered terrorism?

'''Survey'''

*'''Yes'''. Political violence is [[WP:EUPHEMISM]]. Censoring the word "terrorism" from the lead, despite being used extensively in reliable sources is a violation of [[WP:DUE]] and [[WP:NOTCENSORED]]. Many articles such as [[Terrorism in India]], [[Terrorism in Europe]], and [[Israel and state-sponsored terrorism]] use "terrorism". Furthermore, Google Trends and other ngrams show the much more common use of "terrorism" compared with "Palestinian political violence" and it's widespread usage in academic literature. === [[Talk:Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign#rfc_CF92CF0|Talk:Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign]] expired 2023-11-27 14:01 ===
* Id: CF92CF0
* User: 67.82.74.5
* Date: 2023-11-27 05:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1187060470|POL 1187060470}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1187102730|POL 1187102730}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Every reliable source cited in the article states that Trump's claims of a stolen election are not merely false but an utter, total fabrication without basis in reality. The descriptor "false" has nevertheless been purged from the lead of the article which states merely, in contradiction to all reliable sources, that "Trump claimed the 2020 election was stolen." No reliable source cited in the article allows Trump to make this claim without immediately pointing out its craven falsity. Yet Wikipedia, for some reason, now does-- in effect, endorsing Trump's claims by failing to point out that they are a proven falsehood in their initial mention in the article, at its most prominent point. This is an outrage, and in total violation of every policy of this encylopedia; indeed, of any Encylopedia or any other publication that purports to be true. Hence, I humbly beseech you that the original, clean version of the article be restored and the descriptor "false" be appended to Trump's claims that the 2020 election was stolen in the lead (and anywhere else it may appear in the article.) 

Question: Should the lead be allowed to omit mention that Trump's claims of a stolen election are false, merely reporting proven and known falsehoods without comment, in contradiction to all reliable sources, or should the previous version of the article rightly pointing out that Trump's claims are false be restored? [[Special:Contributions/67.82.74.5|67.82.74.5]] ([[User talk:67.82.74.5|talk]]) 05:13, 27 November 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign#rfc_7E90557|Talk:Donald Trump 2024 presidential campaign]] expired 2023-11-27 18:01 ===
* Id: 7E90557
* User: 67.82.74.5
* Date: 2023-11-27 05:13:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1187110039|POL 1187110039}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1187134816|POL 1187134816}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
It is a proven, well-known, reliably sourced, and documented fact that Trump's claims of a "stolen election" are false. Indeed, every reliable source cited in the article states that Trump's claims of a stolen election are not merely false but an utter, total fabrication without any basis in reality. The descriptor "false" has nevertheless been purged from the point of the article where these claims are introduced, which merely states, in contradiction to all reliable sources, that "Trump claimed the 2020 election was stolen." No reliable source cited in the article allows Trump to make this claim without immediately pointing out its total falsity. Yet Wikipedia, for some reason, now does-- in effect, endorsing Trump's claims by failing to point out that they are a proven falsehood in their initial mention in the article, at its most prominent point. Hence, I humbly ask you whether the prior version of the article be restored and the descriptor "false" be appended to Trump's claims that the 2020 election was stolen in the lead (and anywhere else it may appear in the article?

Question: Should the article be allowed to introduce Trump's claims of a stolen election without stating that they are false, circulating and reporting proven and known falsehoods without comment, in contradiction to all reliable sources cited in the article, or should the previous version of the article rightly pointing out that Trump's claims are false be restored? [[Special:Contributions/67.82.74.5|67.82.74.5]] ([[User talk:67.82.74.5|talk]]) 05:13, 27 November 2023 (UTC)}}

* Id: D0CCDEF
* User: Avgeekamfot
* Date: 2023-11-27 08:43:00

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I'm not very experienced so please correct me if I'm not going about this correctly. I've noticed that a vast number of aviation articles utilize information sourced exclusively to https://simpleflying.com which is a content farm that regularly plagiarizes other publications, doesn't have a reputation for fact checking, or otherwise being reliable. I began removing citations to simpleflying but realize that given how many articles utilize it, I should seek input. 

I [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard/Archive 286#Simple Flying|found a previous discussion that seems to agree with my perspective]]. It contains a lot of information but anything that's noteworthy in the aviation/airlines/airports space will have gotten coverage from more reliable publications or local news.

I believe that it should be [[Wikipedia:Deprecated sources|"deprecated"]]. [[User:Avgeekamfot|Avgeekamfot]] ([[User talk:Avgeekamfot|talk]]) 08:43, 27 November 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Doctor Who (series 14)#rfc_2D7C346|Talk:Doctor Who (series 14)]] expired 2023-12-03 00:02 ===
* Id: 2D7C346
* User: Alex 21
* Date: 2023-12-01 07:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1187765897|MEDIA 1187765897}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1188035599|MEDIA 1188035599}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Per [[WP:WHO/MOS#Terminology]], the previous seasons/series of ''Doctor Who'' have been titled "Season #" for the classic era, and "Series #" for the revived era, noting the difference from when the programme moved from Season 26 to Series 1 upon the 2005 revival. This had lead up to Series 13 in 2021. According to interviews with the showrunner, as well as entries on the official ''Doctor Who'' websites, the numbering system is to be reset, to define a new "era". That is, what has previous been referred to as Series 14, will now be referred to as Season 1.

The questions are:
# Should this article be retitled to reflect this change to "Season 1", or should it remain at its "Series 14" title?
# If the article should be renamed, what should it be renamed to? (This is given that [[Doctor Who (season 1)]] already exists, representing the 1963–64 season, and [[Doctor Who (series 1)]] exists, representing the 2005 series.)
# Upon this renaming, should (and thus, what) should the previous seasons be renamed to?
Note that if this article title is changed, this should reflect upon the following entries within the programme. -- [[User:Alex 21|<span style="font-variant:small-caps;color:#02B">Alex_</span><span style="font-size:smaller;color:#02B">21</span>]]<sub>&nbsp;[[User talk:Alex 21|<span style="font-size:xx-small;color:#009">TALK</span>]]</sub> 07:51, 1 December 2023 (UTC)}}

How should we mention past Hamas presence in the hospital in the lede?

=== [[Talk:Freddie Freeman#rfc_A749FC2|Talk:Freddie Freeman]] expired 2023-12-04 00:01 ===
* Id: A749FC2
* User: JDDJS
* Date: 2023-11-03 23:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1183386207|BIO 1183386207}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1183386213|SOC 1183386213}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1188209363|BIO 1188209363}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1188209370|SOC 1188209370}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 Should he be referred to as American and Canadian or just American in the lead? See [[MOS:ETHNICITY]] for the relevant policy. Note the above conversation. <span style="color:green;">[[User:JDDJS|<span style="color:green;">JDDJS</span>]] ([[User talk:JDDJS|<span style="color:purple;">talk to me</span>]] • [[Special:Contributions/JDDJS|<span style="color:purple;">see what I've done</span>]])</span> 23:02, 3 November 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Christopher Columbus#rfc_47C4EDE|Talk:Christopher Columbus]] expired 2023-12-05 00:01 ===
* Id: 47C4EDE
* User: Mikola22
* Date: 2023-12-04 06:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1188254761|BIO 1188254761}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|1188369045|BIO 1188369045}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the note behind the Italian there is the following information: ''"Though the modern state of Italy had yet to be established, the Latin equivalent of the term Italian had been in use for natives of the region since antiquity; most scholars believe Columbus was born in the Republic of Genoa"''. 

*'''1.''' Is this information in accordance with the sources, context in the sources which is relevant to this article and Wikipedia rules? And in this sense, this information is in accordance with which sources, which context and which Wikipedia rules?

*'''2.'''This information is not in accordance with the sources, context in the sources which is relevant to this article and Wikipedia rules? And in this sense, this information is not in accordance with which sources, which source context and which Wikipedia rules?

Each editor can choose option 1 or 2, explain position on the matter, and in this context each editor can express opinion whether cited information is legitimate or not, in accordance with the rules or not, etc, ie should the same be removed or not from introduction part and the article. [[User:Mikola22|Mikola22]] ([[User talk:Mikola22|talk]]) 06:26, 4 December 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard#rfc_2091464|Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Noticeboard]] expired 2023-12-05 00:01 ===
* Id: 2091464
* User: The Kip
* Date: 2023-12-03 07:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1188090676|MEDIA 1188090676}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|1188369053|MEDIA 1188369053}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
What is the reliability of ''[[Sports Illustrated]]''?

* '''Option 1:''' [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Perennial sources#Generally reliable|Generally reliable]]
* '''Option 2:''' [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Perennial sources#No consensus|Additional considerations]]
* '''Option 3:''' [[Wikipedia:Perennial sources#Generally unreliable|Generally unreliable]]
* '''Option 4:''' [[Wikipedia:Reliable sources/Perennial sources#Deprecated|Deprecate]]

Apologies for any issues with this filing, as I've never actually opened an RfC before. Anyhow, as per the discussion going on [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard#Sports_Illustrated here], SI was recently caught [https://futurism.com/sports-illustrated-ai-generated-writers utilizing AI-generated writers], although they [https://apnews.com/article/journalists-ai-counterfeit-writers-479cc3869c0638df5bbb26d4b1e4f18f deny any published articles were AI-written]. SI is [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?search=insource%3A%22si.com%22&title=Special:Search&profile=advanced&fulltext=1&ns0=1&ns1=1 used extensively] on WP, albeit obviously many of these articles predate this AI experiment. As noted by @[[User:InfiniteNexus|InfiniteNexus]] in the linked discussion, CNET did similar earlier this year and its post-2020 acquisition content [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Reliable_sources/Noticeboard/Archive_398#Beware:_CNet_running_AI-generated_articles,_byline_%22CNet_Money%22 promptly got deprecated as a result]. Should we consider doing the same? [[User:The Kip|<span style="color:#333f42;">'''The'''</span>]] [[User talk:The Kip|<span style="color:#b4975a;">'''Kip'''</span>]] 07:40, 3 December 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion#rfc_956A5A6|Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion]] expired 2023-12-05 23:01 ===
* Id: 956A5A6
* User: OwenX
* Date: 2023-11-28 21:02:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1187379109|POLICY 1187379109}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1188517753|POLICY 1188517753}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
An [[WP:Deletion_review/Log/2023_November_22|ongoing DRV discussion]] brought up the question of whether the "sufficiently identical" language in CSD:G4 applies to pages deleted in AfD, and immediately recreated as a redirect by someone who wasn't pleased with the result of the AfD. Several editors believe that since the redirect page is different from the one deleted, any editor is welcome to recreate the deleted page, ''even if the "Redirect" option was brought up in the AfD and failed to reach consensus''.

The options, as I see it, are:
# G4 applies to all cases where consensus was not followed, including recreation of a page as a redirect.
# G4 does not apply to the recreation of a deleted page as a redirect, even if that option was discussed and rejected in the AfD.
# G4 applies to the recreation of a deleted page as a redirect, but only if that option was brought up and rejected in the AfD.
# Other?

To be clear, we are talking about a page recreated shortly (<30 days) after an AfD closed as ''Delete''.

Either way, there seems to be enough confusion about this to justify adding a sentence about recreation as a redirect to the language in CSD:G4.

Would appreciate more views on the subject. Thank you! [[User:OwenX|Owen&times;]] [[User talk:OwenX|<big>&#9742;</big>]] 21:02, 28 November 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Biology#rfc_889A1CD|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Biology]] expired 2023-12-09 19:01 ===
* Id: 889A1CD
* User: Elemimele
* Date: 2023-11-09 18:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1184327547|SCI 1184327547}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1184327566|POLICY 1184327566}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|1189105356|SCI 1189105356}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|1189105358|POLICY 1189105358}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we, or should we not, delete articles about species that are not properly accepted?

The context for this RfC is a number of recent AfD debates on deletion of articles about species that have been described, but whose names have never been properly accepted, for example [[Stomopteryx splendens]]. [[WP:SPECIES]] advises that we should keep articles on valid species, but it doesn't give any advice on what to do about non-valid species. [[User:Elemimele|Elemimele]] ([[User talk:Elemimele|talk]]) 18:23, 9 November 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Totalitarianism#rfc_BE487DB|Talk:Totalitarianism]] expired 2023-12-10 23:01 ===
* Id: BE487DB
* User: WikiUser4020
* Date: 2023-12-02 12:35:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1188501564|HIST 1188501564}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1188501568|POL 1188501568}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1188501572|SOC 1188501572}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1189290578|HIST 1189290578}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|1189290579|POL 1189290579}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1189290581|SOC 1189290581}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
IMO - The current paragraph on Vladmir Lenin has a number of problems in regards to neutrality. 

Firstly - It presents the totalitarian model/view of the Soviet Union as a universally accepted fact among historians and scholars. This model is one school of thought which is often juxtaposed against the revisionist view of the Soviet Union. 

Secondarily - It makes no reference to the historical context or whether Lenin consciously sought to develop a totalitarian state which later progressed into Stalinism or whether this was the byproduct of the specific event i.e. Civil War and foreign intervention.

I have sought to make a number of amendments for the purpose of neutrality and added the sources below.

This is the sentence I am proposing for inclusion into the main paragraph and would like to receive the votes of others for consensus.

'''"However, this view of an inherent totalitarianism in Lenin's views has remained a contested issue in modern historiography.<ref>{{cite book |last1=Priestland |first1=David |title=Stalinism and the Politics of Mobilization: Ideas, Power, and Terror in Inter-war Russia |date=1 February 2007 |publisher=OUP Oxford |isbn=978-0-19-152965-8 |pages=1-60 |url=https://www.google.co.uk/books/edition/Stalinism_and_the_Politics_of_Mobilizati/LQ1REAAAQBAJ?hl=en&gbpv=0 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |last1=Hough |first1=Jerry F. |title=The "Dark Forces," the Totalitarian Model, and Soviet History |journal=The Russian Review |date=1987 |volume=46 |issue=4 |pages=397–403 |doi=10.2307/130293 |url=https://www.jstor.org/stable/130293 |issn=0036-0341}}</ref> Some scholars have attributed the establishment of the one-party system in the Soviet Union to the wartime conditions imposed on the Bolshevik government<ref>{{cite book |last1=Rogovin |first1=Vadim Zakharovich |title=Was There an Alternative? Trotskyism: a Look Back Through the Years |date=2021 |publisher=Mehring Books |isbn=978-1-893638-97-6 |pages=13–14 |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |last1=Liebman |first1=Marcel |title=Leninism Under Lenin |date=1985 |publisher=Merlin Press |isbn=978-0-85036-261-9 |pages=1–348 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=OQjzAAAAMAAJ |language=en}}</ref> and others have highlighted the initial attempts to form a coalition government with the [[Left Socialist-Revolutionaries|Left Socialist Revolutionaries]].<ref>{{cite book |last1=Carr |first1=Edward Hallett |title=The Bolshevik revolution 1917 - 1923. Vol. 1 |date=1977 |publisher=Penguin books |isbn=978-0-14-020749-1 |pages=111–112 |edition=Reprinted}}</ref>"'''

I have included Marxist and non-Marxist historians/scholars for balance. [[User:WikiUser4020|WikiUser4020]] ([[User talk:WikiUser4020|talk]]) 12:35, 2 December 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Shohei Ohtani#rfc_9F56681|Talk:Shohei Ohtani]] expired 2023-12-12 16:01 ===
* Id: 9F56681
* User: The ed17
* Date: 2023-12-09 23:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1189140834|SOC 1189140834}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|1189557179|SOC 1189557179}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Baseball player Shohei Ohtani has agreed to the terms of a contract with the [[Los Angeles Dodgers]]. That agreement has not been published by the Dodgers themselves yet, nor have they announced that a contract has been signed. However, the agreement has been announced by [https://www.instagram.com/p/C0pR_vyvLpR/ Ohtani themselves], [https://twitter.com/jjcoop36/status/1733580301589197022 his agency], and posted by [https://twitter.com/MLB/status/1733579715909169215 the official MLB Twitter]. There's significant secondary coverage of the announcement in [https://theathletic.com/5106526/2023/12/09/shohei-ohtani-signs/ ''The Athletic''] and several other high-quality outlets, like [https://www.cbssports.com/mlb/news/shohei-ohtani-signs-with-dodgers-two-way-superstar-joins-l-a-team-on-record-breaking-10-year-700m-deal/ CBS Sports]. Those two sources confirm that Ohtani himself announced the arrangement. 

Should the information [that Ohtani says he has agreed to a contract but no official announcement has been made] be included in this article prior to an official announcement by the Dodgers? Applicable guidelines here include [[WP:RSBREAKING]], in addition to the essay [[WP:SPORTSTRANS]]. BLP, specifically [[WP:BLPGOSSIP]] or [[WP:GRAPEVINE]], do not appear to factor in as Ohtani has spoken on this himself. [[User:The ed17|Ed]]&nbsp;<sup>[[User talk:The ed17|[talk]]]&nbsp;[[WP:OMT|[OMT]]]</sup> 23:27, 9 December 2023 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Harka (Maghreb)#rfc_DFE481D|Talk:Harka (Maghreb)]] expired 2023-12-12 17:01 ===
* Id: DFE481D
* User: Ideophagous
* Date: 2023-11-12 16:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1184788348|HIST 1184788348}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1184788349|LANG 1184788349}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|1189565865|HIST 1189565865}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Language_and_linguistics|prev|1189565869|LANG 1189565869}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There's a dispute between @[[User:M.Bitton|M.Bitton]] and myself as to whether the article should contain [[:Category:Moroccan Arabic words and phrases]]. M.Bitton claims it should not be added on the basis that the term is not exclusively Moroccan. I don't think this is a necessary condition, and adding that category does not exclude adding similar categories for Tunisian and Algerian Arabic, provided there are sources to support. M.Bitton keeps removing the changes I made in the article, including a reliable source (Dictionary of Moroccan Arabic). So as to avoid edit warring, I request comments from experienced editors in the project.--[[User:Ideophagous|Ideophagous]] ([[User talk:Ideophagous|talk]]) 16:14, 12 November 2023 (UTC)}}
